ProviderLocation: 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: We decided on a quick getaway to The Rittenhouse Hotel for Valentines Day. The Rittenhouse offered a few packages which were excellent. Our package included free overnight parking, a certificate for two drinks in the bar, various coupons for entry to some local activities.It also included a $10. credit for UBER. And, because we're I Prefer members we also received breakfast which we had delivered to our very large King size suite. Our suite was lovely even though they were in the midst of a remodel. The staff was lovely from the moment we entered. They could not have been more helpful, pleasant and professional---Thank You! The next day the valet brought our car around and, we were back to reality. We're already planning another getaway to The Rittenhouse.

ProviderLocation: 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: Stayed here for 3 nights on my first trip to Philly. Great location to explore the city. Easy to walk to cab/Uber anywhere. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are quite large. We had a nice city view. The shower was a bit temperamental in terms of temperature. But nice bathrooms. Enjoyed staying here. They have a nice bar as well. On Saturday night they bar had a great musical trio playing. Highly recommend for a tourist or romantic getaway.

ProviderLocation: 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: My wife and I went to visit my daughter and celebrate her 21st birthday with her. The hotel was a very pleasant experience. Great spot in the city (spring like weather in February didn't hurt!). We had a park view King room. The view of the park was lovely. Good sized room, very comfortable, nice amenities, etc. Had a drink at the Library Bar with my daughter. Kind of strange to be sitting at a bar with your kid for the 1st time. The drinks were typical of hotel bar. Not cheap but a good pour. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The hotel has an afternoon tea. While we didn't have time this trip to partake it looked good and I hope to get back there for tea in the future. The breakfast at Lacroix was fine...standard buffet fare for an upscale hotel. I would stay here again.

ProviderLocation: 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: The Rittenhouse is by far the leader when it comes to luxury and taking care of it'so guests. From turn down service, to packages given (birthdays, valentine's day, etc...), to spa, pool, sauna,. Everything is superb. The staff is top notch from the gentlemen who do valet to the concierge. Best experience we have had, bar none. And all of it in the heart of the city. I would recommend the Rittenhouse to any and all who wish to have an amazing experience.
ReviewTitle: Most amazing stay ever hands down

ProviderLocation: 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: If you want to experience Philadelphia, you'd be hard pressed to find a better spot than Rittenhouse Square and the Rittenhouse Hotel. The hotel offers a spa, salon, pool, great restaurants and parking....all in the center of the city. Shopping and museums are within walking distance. My favorite place in Philadelphia

ProviderLocation: 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I travel for business all the time and this was my first stay at The Rittenhouse. I cannot express the consistent level of service that I received from each and every person I encountered. From Dan at concierge, to Thomas at the front desk. However, I feel compelled to really single out Sadira Dunn, Front Desk Agent. From my initial arrival she stayed connected with me during my visit to ensure that every need was addressed. It was stunning! I typically stay at the Mandarin Oriental, Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons based on location because I hope to receive a mere slice of the type of service that Sadira executed consistently during my 24 hour stay. I will be back!

ProviderLocation: 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I stayed here for 3 nights while I was on vacation in the US and the Hotel was truly exceptional. The location is great and there are many shops and restaurants within a short walk of the Hotel. The decor in the lobby is very grand and you feel like you have stepped into a classy establishment. On check in I was presented with a letter offering me a free high tea and also a small card offering complimentary cappuccino or wine in the bar. I thought these were all very nice touches. The room itself is huge. I had a desk and chair and then two separate lounge like chairs as well. The King size bed was also very comfortable. There was a table with snacks and then around the corner was the dressing area with a coffee machine, bottled water etc. Next to the coffee machine were large sturdy take away cups and lids like you receive from most coffee chains. So before going out to explore Philly you could make coffee in the room and then take it with you. The bathroom was very large with a separate bath and shower. The wash basin was a good size with lots of toiletries. The shower was enormous and you could probably fit an entire soccer team in there if you are so inclined. On the first night when I got back to the room there were two fresh pretzels with a bottle of Dijon mustard waiting for me as well as a bottle of Philadelphia root beer. It is these small touches that makes this Hotel exceptional. There is also a green rubber frog in the room. If you want to go green you place the frog on the bed and housekeeping will make your bed with the same linen. I thought this was cute and a nice idea instead of an ugly card that most hotels have. I had a lot of valuables with me and my only criticism is the in room safe which is quite narrow and is essentially at floor level. So I found myself literally on the floor removing items when I needed them. A much larger safe at eye level in the main cupboard would be more useful. If you're coming to Philly look no further and book this Hotel. As I said earlier it is an exceptional property with very spacious comfortable rooms.

ProviderLocation: 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I have periodically visited this hotel between 2012 to 2016. I have had a problem of a stalker at the hotel. On August 18, 2013, a 'person of interest' fired a shot at me in the driveway as I returned from Barnes and Noble. The biggest threat, however, was an unknown person knocking on my door to disrupt normal sleep. The last day that I visited, March 10, 2016, five times in two hours I had my sleep disrupted. I made commonsensical recommendations to fix these irregularities to Reginald Archambault. He dismissed them out of hand.. He then banned me from the hotel because he said I jeopardized his career with the Board of Trustees. Yes, kill the messenger and violate his right to equal protection under the laws. This discrimination, based on class (wealth) status morally offended me. Not only that he broke the laws about the accessibility of this hotel to people of all walks of life.
ReviewTitle: The security of this hotel is not effective.

ProviderLocation: 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 210 West Rittenhouse Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I stayed at the Rittenhouse for my college reunion, and remember back in the day, that it was THE place to stay. Well, it is certainly lovely, and the service is still 5-star, but the rooms are in need of a renovation. The bathrooms, in particular, are very dated, as are the furnishings within the room. That said, the bed was very comfortable, and the location cannot be beat. Oh, and the gym is spacious and excellent. Hoping they renovate the hotel soon, so I'm inclined to return in the future.
ReviewTitle: Nice stay in property showing its age

ProviderLocation: 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Hotel Staff is pleasant and helpful. Hotel accommodations are just right. Easy off site parking garage (1 block away). Hotel location is perfect for walking to historic sites, restaurants, bars, late night pizza run and nearby movie theater. Get away, enjoy 2nd & Chestnut for 1 or 2 nights with someone special. BW makes Philly hassle free.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Independence Park Hotel
ProviderLocation: 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Great location and beautiful hotel. We were a short walk (about 2-3 blocks) away from the Liberty Bell, Independence Hall, museums, restaurants, etc. Charming and historic, but with modern amenities makes this the perfect place for a visit to Philly. The price was reasonable and fair. Parking was affordable for city parking. The afternoon tea and complimentary breakfast made this the perfect choice for our stay and we would stay here again if in the area. The staff were friendly and accomodating. the interior was beautifully and tastefully decorated. The rooms were on the smaller side, but that would be expected in this historic building. However, we did not feel cramped or uncomfortable at any time. The property was extremely clean and the dining area was very upscale compared to other hotels at this level.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Independence Park Hotel
ProviderLocation: 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: This hotel was so welcoming and great staff. The hotel reminded me of like an old fashioned hotel it was so beautiful and in a great spot. The lady at the front desk name was Lauren was so welcoming. The bathrooms were so clean and the rooms.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Independence Park Hotel
ProviderLocation: 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Easy to get to. Polite, friendly, and well-trained staff. Clean and quiet. Excellent (and affordable) parking. Phenomenal complimentary breakfast. Easy access to public transportation. Excellent coaching for front desk staff on best ways to get to public transportation (and which bus and subway routes to take).

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Independence Park Hotel
ProviderLocation: 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: The stay was very comfortable,clean & reasonable. The host was very knowledgeable with the amenities as well as directions to & from parking. We really enjoyed our stay at Best Western. I deeply appreciate the hospitality that was shown throughout my stay

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Independence Park Hotel
ProviderLocation: 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: I stayed for three nights recently at the Best Western Independence Park Hotel. It's a beautiful old building with a lovely lobby area. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Everyone there was very helpful and I had a great stay. I can highly recommend it. Julian behind the front desk was very friendly and helpful. I'd happily return. It's also very close to the Old City attractions.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Independence Park Hotel
ProviderLocation: 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: The staff was extremely pleasant & helpful. The continental breakfast had good variety and offered options for health allergies. The room was very nice and clean. Parking was right down the block. Having to stop at the hotel to get a parking pass and return it was a little cumbersome & difficult depending on parking & traffic. Easy access to the Old City tourist destinations. Overall a wonderful trip.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Independence Park Hotel
ProviderLocation: 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: The hotel is the best location for visiting Olde City Philadelphia and it is located in an older renovated building... The historical features (curved stairway into lobby and the facade) add character and charm.The included hot breakfast served in a bright atrium was more than substantial and the staff was very welcoming and personable.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Independence Park Hotel
ProviderLocation: 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Loved the hotel, services was great with a friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is in a great location near the Liberty Bell, Independence Hall and all of Old Town. Because it is small the staff can service you better. Comfortable and historic.

ProviderName: BEST WESTERN PLUS Independence Park Hotel
ProviderLocation: 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 235 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Almost everything was perfect - the location, in the heart of Old City, right next to restaurants, bars, even a deli, and most importantly - the Independence Hall. Perfect spot to start your visit. The staff was very helpful, polite and can't single out any exceptional employee because everybody was exceptional :) The breakfasts were very good. The only thing I would like to point out is that there is no in-room safe if that's important to you. When I booked it the description said I would have it but nope, it's not there. Very minor inconvenience though, especially since they have a safe downstairs.

ProviderLocation: 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel) 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: The Hotel Monaco will continue to be our "go to" hotel when we visit Philly. A perfect location for us in the Old City; it is clean, the d√©cor is fun, and the staff is accommodating. Thanks for the complimentary upgrade to a room with a view of Independence Hall, looking forward to our next visit!

ProviderLocation: 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel) 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: I booked this hotel and called prior to my stay for information about the hotel and getting information about the local area since I was planning on taking my girlfriend to the area for her birthday. Ingrid was such an amazing and wonderful person to speak with. She was so thoughtful and helpful and even helped me get a better room by offering me an upgrade surcharge for a room overlooking the Independence Park area. This was something that I didn't even know was an option. Ingrid went above and beyond and even surprised us with an upgraded room and a nice amenity in the room wishing my girlfriend a happy birthday. And, as if that wasn't enough, she had mimosas delivered in the morning of our departure along with a card. It was such a nice touch and something that neither my girlfriend or I will ever forget. Thank you so much Ingrid for your hospitality and by perhaps making this getaway the most special one ever. It really was incredible how Ingrid went above and beyond and personalized our stay by adding little details and ensuring that our stay was a wonderful one. Thank you so much! I will definitely return on my next visit to the city.
ReviewTitle: The best vacation and hotel stay ever thanks to Ingrid!

ProviderLocation: 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel) 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: This was probably the highlight of my trip to Philly, this hotel is perfect!! I'm a Kimpton girl but this one property made me gush. It's situated in a perfect spot, close to the liberty bell and just about anything else you need. The rooms are spacious, the bathtubs are to die for in the rooms, and the lobby bar/restaurant are superb in not only service but quality of food and drinks. I will recommend this place and hope to come back one day!

ProviderLocation: 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel) 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: I'll make this quick and short. Service- outstanding. Everyone from reception to housekeeping were friendly and welcoming. I called front desk and asked for a phone charger, guy was at my door in under 2 min. He even set up my free wifi account with a smile. Room nice, well decorated a little dark but elegant. Clean. Nice bathroom. The bedspread was a little messy and undone- it surprised me. We didn't eat there so no comment on food. Nice fitness room with great equipment which I didn't use bec as a woman alone I was afraid to be in an enclosed room by myself. You ladies know what I mean. Was a good experience. But I would try somewhere dif next time. Also, very pet friendly. I'm not a doggy person but if u are this is the hotel for you. Also, great location.

ProviderLocation: 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel) 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: ....and we have stayed in all of them. Never disappointed with the Kimpton brand. Just an outstanding one night stay for us. Booked through Priceline and got a good deal for $90. Staff was terrific at check-in. We were given a king room with a great view of Independence Hall on the 10th floor. The room itself was perfect, loved the decor and it was plenty big enough. The bed was very comfortable and sleeping was quiet. Bathroom was also good size and spotless. Did not use the gym, but it was very nice. We did have drinks at the Red Owl Tavern, but didn't eat. A word of caution that the late night room service menu is extremely limited. We look forward to our next stay at Hotel Monaco.
ReviewTitle: There's not a better hotel in Philly

ProviderLocation: 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel) 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel as a gift from my husband. It was my escape by myself in the city I love. The location is perfect and I had a view of Independence Hall from my bed, doesn't get any better for this history buff. The room is eclectic and gorgeous. I loved the slight Alice in Wonderland Theme (you really have to pay attention to details to get it). The check-in was super easy and fast. The wine hour was perfection. It was so peaceful and the wine was pretty good. You can have a selection of red/white wine, beer or a hot apple cider. Dinner was at Buddakan. If you have never been it is worth going to! It is a block away. I parked at The Bourse for $25 and had coffee at Cosi. They took down the coffee bar before 9 AM so I wasn't able to grab a cup. I want to go back with my husband and kids and explore the city with them. I highly recommend! Oh and if you want to relax, bring your own bubble bath soap and enjoy the soaking tub! Fantastic!

ProviderLocation: 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel) 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: Stayed two nights in December. Room very comfortable and plenty of space for one or two people. Exercise facility open 24hrs. Welcoming staff, engaging front lobby. Restaurant offers terrific options for a brief "after-dinner" dinner food. They do close at 10pm during week days. Literally across the street from Independence Hall! Parking is valet only and spendy with this location. Would definitely stay here for business travel or a weekend getaway. Clean, comfortable, convenient, and classy.
ReviewTitle: Comfortable, well appointed, great location, great amenities

ProviderLocation: 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel) 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: I recently had two stays at the Monaco and was extremely pleased. The queen/queen room was very spacious, clean, and well appointed. The staff I interacted with were all pleasant and helpful. The inner circle amenity on both stays was exactly as I have noted on my account. Though I live in the area, the Monaco has become my go to hotel in Philadelphia.

ProviderLocation: 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel) 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: I had a really good experience at the Hotel Monaco. Their rooms are superbly decorated, the facility well maintained, and the staff was really very friendly. I want to take the time in this review to recognize Samantha for making sure that my accommodation was top-notch. Some of the benefits of staying at this hotel is the ability to walk on Chestnut Street to a plethora of really good restaurants and the ability to see the Liberty Bell at hours that most would not do because they don't have the luxury of having the bell across the street from the hotel! I really enjoyed my stay and will return again.

ProviderLocation: 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel) 433 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106-2426 (Formerly Hotel Monaco Philadelphia, a Kimpton Hotel)
ReviewText: Hotel Monacos exist in a number of cities and now in Philadelphia. This property was originally a prominent office building overlooking Independence Mall the site of Independence Hall and the Liberty Bell. It's a very trendy hotel chain with each property having its own distinct decor and personality. Their restaurant called THE RED OWL is attractive and offers casual dining from burgers to more elaborate meals but all is fresh attractive and reasonably priced for the location in the historic area
ReviewTitle: New restoration of 100 year old building into luxury hotel

ProviderLocation: 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5025 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5025
ReviewText: This was our second stay here and we enjoyed it as much as the first time. Location: Terrific for downtown activities. An easy walk to the Barnes Foundation and convenient for shopping and dining in Center City. Service: The staff is super friendly and helpful, even when it's busy. They really truly make you feel welcome, even more than I remember at other Kimptons. Room: It's a standard Kimpton. Room was a decent size. Clean and stylish, of course. Pluses: It's the little things, right? Kimpton members get free wifi (which worked great) and we got $10 towards the ridiculously overpriced minibar, but it was enough to take the edge off our hunger before dinner. The almonds, btw, are really, really good. We also got the Sunday NYT delivered, which I wish I'd known before we headed out for breakfast because it's awesome to read the Sunday Times in your jammies, but it definitely kept us entertained as we sipped our coffees. Price: Varies a lot. Can be high, can be mid. Warning: Parking in the neighborhood is expensive. We used a parking app to book online in advance.

ProviderLocation: 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5025 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5025
ReviewText: We had planned a getaway after Valentine's Day and unfortunately we had issues getting to Philadelphia the night of our booking. The hotel accommodated us and switched the reservation for the new dates, even though it was a holiday weekend. There is coffee and tea in the mornings available in the lobby and wine in the evenings. They have water out front and are dog friendly! The location of the hotel is in a great neighborhood and the staff was super friendly and helpful. We had a wonderful time.

ProviderLocation: 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5025 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5025
ReviewText: We stayed here for one night and were very happy with the location, cleanliness of our room and friendliness of the staff! Upon arrival we were given champagne which was a great way to start our trip! The hotel was in walking distance of many popular sites and great restaurants so we did not need to use our car. The decor was very modern and tasteful and the wine and popcorn hour was a nice touch! This is the 2nd Kimpton hotel we have stayed at and we could not have been happier with the experience!

ProviderLocation: 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5025 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5025
ReviewText: We booked a stay at the Palomar in Philadelphia, for my wife's birthday arriving on Saturday, February 18. From the minute I walked toward the front desk, I knew we picked the perfect place! The hotel staff was the most inviting, friendliest and caring people you could imagine. Their commitment to make our stay memorable, relaxing and enjoyable was short of nothing. We were immediately checked into our room and from there we headed to our 2 PM show at the Walnut St. theater. The also invited us to join other guests in the main lobby at 5 PM for Happy Hour, consisting of wine and champagne! We thoroughly enjoyed the invite and the drinks!! Our room was somewhat small but beautifully designed and decorated. My wife was pleasantly surprised when we returned back to our room later in the evening. The hotel staff had put a bottle of wine with 2 glasses, a bottle of water and a beautiful desert cake in our room, along with a personalized card to her , wishing her a happy birthday. It's little gestures like these that go a long way! We had the most wonderful stay at the Palomar and look forward to returning soon. The management and staff at the Palomar truly put the customer experience first and foremost, and in my opinion, will do whatever it takes to make your stay a great experience! P.S. The guy's that work the front door are very professional and sociable. It was a real pleasure speaking with all of them, just really great people!!!

ProviderLocation: 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5025 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5025
ReviewText: Was in town for the weekend to celebrate our anniversary. We have stayed at the Palomar before and have always had an excellent experience. The staff is wonderful and always pleasant and helpful. The location is also really nice. Easy walking distance to great restaurants and bars. Would definitely stay at the Palomar again.

ProviderLocation: 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5025 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5025
ReviewText: Escaping D.C. during inauguration, I turned my sights to Philadelphia for the weekend. Arriving before any rooms were ready, the hotel will hold your luggage while you explore the city. Walkable distance to the subway, it was easy to see various art museums while I waited to check-in. Upon my return, Johnathan is the person you must ask for. Casually stating that I drank sparkling water, he randomly sent some up to me during my stay. Since I deemed my trip a staycation, I never left my room but that didn't stop me from experiencing some of the great food locations that are literally within walking distance. Federal Donuts is just around the corner as well as a few other places that are magazine recognized. Don't feel like leaving either? Order from TryCaviar which delivers to the hotel from some of these same restaurants, and the hotel will allow them to deliver to your room.
ReviewTitle: If You're A Foodie, This Place is for You

ProviderLocation: 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5025 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5025
ReviewText: I love staying in Kimpton hotels, and the Palomar in Philadelphia did not disappoint. It's a great location in Center City, close to Rittenhouse Square, and in the middle of great Philly shopping and dining. There's also a Philly Soft Pretzel factory right across the street!! It's a converted building, so it was great to see some of the original details, especially in the 2nd floor elevator lobby. My room was comfy and the bathroom was small, but well laid out. The staff was super friendly at all times. It really does pay off to be a Karma member, the complimentary Internet was perhaps the fastest I've ever had in a hotel, and the raid the bar credit provided a well needed late night snickers bar. One thing to be aware of, the elevators are somewhat slow. There's 4 of them, but there was always a wait going up or down, and they can get crowded. But there were a couple of times I was in the elevator with super friendly dogs so that made up for it and the elevator decorations are cool. All in all, a really great hotel that I will check out again next time I'm in Philly.

ProviderLocation: 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5025 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5025
ReviewText: I'm going to start off with the negatives first: 1. The hot water in the shower wasn't. I actually had goosebumps when I stepped out of the shower the first night I was there, and yes, the heat was on. The shower head must have been installed by someone 7'6" as trying to adjust it was impossible because I couldn't reach it. Only once was the water warm enough (not hot) to leave some steam on the bathroom mirror. If you have back issues as I do, a hot shower to help loosen tight back muscles is a must. 2. I spent two and a half hours my first day there tracking down a place that sold postcards, which are a lot harder to find than they used to be. I went to send out 11 of them to places within the U.S. and overseas on Christmas Eve, and I asked Matt at the front desk if there was a post office in the area. He shook his head no. "No? I don't mind walking," I said, as I log about 7-8 miles per day when I am in Philly. "No, give them to us. We have mail pick-up and I will put them in the bin to go out." I gave him the postcards and that was that. Yesterday (six days later) none of the 11 had reached their destination, so I called the hotel. Once again, I spoke to Matt. I explained the situation and said that at least some of them should have been received by now, as one was going elsewhere in PA and one was going to Brooklyn. He went to check the outgoing bin and came back and said they were not in there. I then asked if they had a regular mail carrier whom they could ask and see if he/she remembered picking the mail up that day. "Well, I can't ask the post office if they had a piece of mail going to Brooklyn," was the reply. I of course agreed with him and said I understood that much. The phone call ended with my asking him to speak to their carrier anyway, and he said he would and we would talk soon. That was yesterday, and I have heard nothing. And the postcards have still not been received by anyone, so they obviously never made it to the post office as it's been a full week. I am perfectly aware that the hotel isn't responsible for what happens to the mail after it leaves the hotel, but the comment about the mail going to Brooklyn was flippant and uncalled for. I also had asked for a post office location and was told to give the mail to them instead. So, I've lost the money I spent on postcards, and international and domestic stamps, as well as spent a lot of time trying to find the postcards to begin with instead of doing something else. I'm also very disappointed that there was no follow-up when there should have been. Don't say you'll call someone later if you are not going to do so. The phone call left a worse impression than the postcards not arriving. The pros: The staff were very nice, and the room was very clean.
ReviewTitle: I so wanted to give this place a better review

ProviderLocation: 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5025 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5025
ReviewText: Very good location for attending sports events. The subway stop for the Sports complex is just a short walk away. Historical sites and University City are also in walking distance. Great people at the reception. special thanks to Sam for the nice chat. Very clean and superb housekeeping. Good room size and free wifi. Would return anytime.

ProviderLocation: 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5025 117 South 17th Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5025
ReviewText: The location is as good as it gets, and the hotel is nicely appointed. Staff is nice. Coffee in the lobby in the morning was good, though I do get a little bummed when I can't make coffee in my room first thing in the morning. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Philadelphia.

ProviderLocation: 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3212 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3212
ReviewText: This was our third stay at the Hilton Inn at Penn and I definitely would recommend this hotel. The hotel is very well managed. The rooms are clean, up-to-date, and nicely furnished with comfortable beds. The hotel has a wood paneled room called the Living Room which is located in the lobby. It is a nice place to read, hold conversations, and relax. We also enjoyed the happy hour at the bar which is located on the ground floor. We did not have dinner at the hotel since it is a little pricey when you add the price of a salad ($12+) and a glass of wine ($12+) to the entree. Instead we had a very good and reasonably priced dinner at an Indian Restaurant on Chestnut Street. There are numerous dining options near the hotel on Walnut Street and Chestnut Street. As before, we had the breakfast buffet. The food was very good and our server, Walker, was very professional and friendly. It was a nice way to begin our day. As for location, the hotel is very close to the Amtrak train station, the Penn Museum, U Penn, and Penn medical facilities. In general, University City is a nice area to visit.

ProviderLocation: 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3212 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3212
ReviewText: Walking distance to University of Penn, Drexel, U of Penn Hospital(s). Clean, comfortable with helpful staff. My wife had to have surgery at the hospital. Since we had to come from out of town, and still check into the hospital at 5am, we made it a special event by staying over at the hotel. It was Valentine's Day. Nearby are some neat local restaurants, great room and wonderfully friendly staff made the time just before surgery a great a time as possible. Thanks, hilton.

ProviderLocation: 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3212 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3212
ReviewText: A nice get away with my wife. No need to worry about driving home after a fun night of partying!! Oh, the the Inn at Penn was very relaxing, clean and staff was great. Can't wait to do it again.......

ProviderLocation: 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3212 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3212
ReviewText: The Inn at Penn is an incredible hotel that is convenient to campus. Being a Diamond member, I enjoyed a complimentary upgrade to an incredible suite. I also think their breakfast is wonderful, with good service and great food.
ReviewTitle: Hilton Inn at Penn is great

ProviderLocation: 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3212 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3212
ReviewText: The Inn at Penn (Hilton) is overall a very nice hotel. The hotel lobby and some other areas have displays of Penn and Philadelphia art works. In addition to their breakfast dining room, there is also an Italian / pasta restaurant on site, Penne, which is pleasant. The guest room we had was nice, with local memorabilia photos for d√©cor. WiFi was pretty good. The only fly in the ointment was the beds, which were much firmer than either of us found comfortable for a good night's sleep. Lighting in the bathroom could stand to be improved -- the overall lighting casts shadows on one's face, that makes shaving or applying makeup a bit of an adventure.
ReviewTitle: Pleasant accomodations, as long as you like hard beds

ProviderLocation: 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3212 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3212
ReviewText: Just across the street from UPenn, this is a newly renovated beautiful place to stay. The restaurant Penne was delicious for a late night dinner with son soon after I arrived. The rain was coming down hard the next day and I was provided with a giant umbrella for my walk around campus.

ProviderLocation: 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3212 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3212
ReviewText: Well received, great experience all around: staff, room, location, breakfast! On a quick weekend between business trips to see my son. Everyone is extremely courteous, service oriented, and very helpful. The friendly atmosphere helped me relax and enjoy my visit. Thanks!

ProviderLocation: 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3212 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3212
ReviewText: The hotel is immaculate. The rooms are luxurious. There is a great library for informal meetings that we used for a family reunion immediately after a friend passed away at the hospital, and an excellent restaurant, Penne, open until 10:45 PM, where we continued our discussions.
ReviewTitle: Great location if visiting loved ones at Hospital of University of Pennsylvania

ProviderLocation: 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3212 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3212
ReviewText: The Inn at Penn is a modern hotel on the U of Pennsylvanian Campus As a Hilton the room is top quality for space, furnishings and comfort It is not a massive hotel 5 floors) so no delays with check in/check,elevators or pt service at breakfast helpful staff and a n in room tablet is provided for guest s use
ReviewTitle: QUIET SPACE In HEART OF A BUSTLING CAMPUS

ProviderLocation: 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3212 3600 Sansom St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3212
ReviewText: I cannot say enough good things about the staff at this hotel. They went out of their way to meet all your needs and more. I unfortunately became ill in the night of my arrival, and the concierge took care of everything I needed. They had me feeling better in no time!
ReviewTitle: Enjoyable stay at the Inn at Penn

ProviderLocation: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor) 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
ReviewText: We just returned from a weekend at the Windsor Suites and were extremely pleased. From my first phone call to make a reservation, to our every dealing with the staff , we were impressed with the level of customer service. Zarena at the the front desk always had a smile and a welcoming word as she answered our every question. Alex was extremely helpful as we struggled to work the Uber App. Another young woman, whose name I did not get, actually walked us outside to make sure we found our driver! The room was spacious, comfortable, and most important to us, quiet. We never heard doors or people in the hallways. Our only problem was that it was unseasonably hot for February and we were unable to turn on the AC. However, unlike most hotels, the windows actually opened which did cool the room. The room was very clean, the bath products were fine, and our king sized bed was very comfortable. The hotel is very well located -- an easy walk to the Barnes Foundation, the Franklin Institute and Rittenhouse Square where we heard a lovely recital by students at the Curtis Institute. We ate breakfast at the attached Con Murphy's (you receive a discount if you are staying at the hotel). The food was good and the portions were enormous! Parking was included in our Overnight Philly package and the parking attendants were prompt and pleasant. Without the package it would have been very expensive but in line with what the other downtown hotels charge. The room had a kitchen but we did not use it. We highly recommend Windsor Suites.
ReviewTitle: A comfortable room, great location, and a staff that went above and beyond!!

ProviderLocation: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor) 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
ReviewText: My Fiance' and I stayed here post Valentine's Day to get away and see the city. The hotel itself was beautiful and they had champagne, Godiva truffles & chocolate covered strawberries in our room since we booked the Romance Package. To start, at check in there was an irate man next to us at te counter. He was being denied check in because he had a prepaid debit card and not an actual banking card. I also had a prepaid debit card because I have dealt with hotels overcharging me and stealing my money or taking forever to refund me. But either way Thomas (the man checking us in) denied my prepaid card as well and luckily my fiance' had his credit card. I dont see why a prepaid card matters because either the money is there or it isnt. These arent just a basic Visa gift card, they are prepaid debit cards that a have an account number & routing number. It's still through a bank. A lot of people that have dealt with fraud & theft like me use them these days. I made my reservation with this prepaid debit card so if they arent excepted that shouldve been stated or verified before I came to check in. After that we were supposed to received 2 free drinks at Con Murphy's, Thomas said just give them our room number and it will be fine. Not that case! We were seated at Con Murphy's for lunch and my fiance" had to get up and go back to the counter to get our VOUCHERS that allowed us 2 free drinks. In the morning our romance package included free BREAKFAST IN BED so we asked Thomas how do we go about that. Thomas told us to call in our order and have it delivered to the room or the lobby and it will be handled. Again, not the case! The worker at Con Murphy said that the breakfast once again needed a VOUCHER that we never received and it was for restaurant dining not in room dining. The girl at Con Murphy's was nice and patient so she made the exception and delivered our breakfast to our room and comp'd it but she still needed a voucher which we didnt have. So my fiance' had to throw on clothes and go downstairs witht the girl and get a voucher from the front desk and by the time he got back upstairs our food was cold. Also, the food was free but disgusting. I was emailed a confirmation from Mathhew B. ( a receptionist) that my check out time would be 1pm since I booked the Romance Package, Thomas and another woman up front both stated that check out time was 12pm, no exceptions. Overall, I wish I never stayed here. The room was nice but the overall service made our stay frustrating. I will remain a Hilton and Hyatt frequent flyer from now on.

ProviderLocation: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor) 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
ReviewText: Clean. Comfortable. Safe. Convenient. Friendly. We look for affordability with safety and cleanliness. When we get the feeling of luxury, too, we're thrilled. Such was what we got at the Windsor Suites in winter. Wished we would have had reason to stay longer. Wished we could have taken advantage of the kitchen. We visited for a simple overnight trip to take advantage of the city's museums and found this to be a perfect location for that.

ProviderLocation: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor) 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
ReviewText: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Windsor and had a great time throughout. We arrived a bit before checkin, so we went downstairs for a beer and a cider at Con Murphys. Our room was quickly available (still before scheduled checkin) and was beautiful with a balcony overlooking the parkway, full size refridgerator, and a very comfortable bed. The room was warm as it was 65 degrees outside in February, but we just turned off the heat. The rate we had included valet parking which was the most convenient I have had in some time. The front desk staff were very accommodating and helped us with directions.

ProviderLocation: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor) 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
ReviewText: From the moment we arrived, we felt like the staff attended to our all of our needs with great care and attention to detail. The Windsor Suites is very clean, well-equipped and luxurious in every way. We purchased the Visit Philly package and were delightfully surprised to have such fine accommodations. Would choose The Windsor Suites again and again!

ProviderLocation: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor) 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
ReviewText: All staff very welcoming. Thank you Brian for great restaurant recommendations ! and entire staff for courteous treatment. Room was spacious and quiet (as I requested), bed was a dream, and entire stay was a pleasure.

ProviderLocation: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor) 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
ReviewText: I was visiting Philadelphia for a few days and stayed at the Windsor. This will probably be the only hotel I stay at from now on when I'm visiting. So beautiful and in a convenient spot in city center near museums. The rooms are simple and beautiful with the modern design. The Kitchenette is a plus. The staff was great, so kind and helpful, especially Tracey, Fetty and the blonde haired gentlemen with glasses at the front desk. The Front desk was able to take care of my needs no questions asked. Thank you so much for a great stay and making it stress free. Only problem I had is that they were doing construction on the room next to mine but it wasn't a big deal.

ProviderLocation: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor) 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
ReviewText: Excellent value and very, very comfortable. Having a kitchen is wonderful! I would definitely stay here again ! Used this hotel as a "stay in town" getaway, as I live in Philly! Can't wait to return very soon!

ProviderLocation: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor) 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
ReviewText: I had a great stay at The Windsor a few weeks ago. My room was quite spacious and was VERY clean. It had a huge walk in closet, and the bed was quite comfortable. This was my first time in Philly and cannot imagine staying anywhere else. I would highly recommend. The location is great for those visiting center city or old city.
ReviewTitle: Great weekend getaway for 1st time Philly visitor

ProviderLocation: 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor) 1700 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Hotel Windsor)
ReviewText: Front desk staff very attentive and helpful. One was Brian, as well as several young women who helped me with suggestions and directions including possible book stores. The garage attendant was also helpful. My only very minor kvetch was the coffee pot - one of those Keurig cup coffee pots - which challenged my limited high tech abilities. Help with that was very prompt as well. Terrific location, as I was in Philadelphia to see the Barnes Foundation collection, and the large windows were also fun, as I could see the city streets and had a view of the skyline. Excellent all around. I also ate at both of the restaurants connected to the hotel - one when I was wet and hungry on arrival in the rainy city, and one when I was tired and hungry after a day of walking and looking at art. Very satisfactory meals and very convenient. Well done!

ProviderLocation: 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: excellent stay at the Loews in Philadelphia; it started with top-notch customer service from everyone including the valet parking attendants, the front desk staff, the concierge and everyone in between. Kudos to the management and staff there. The hotel is also in a really convenient location. We highly recommend it.

ProviderLocation: 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: We stayed on the 27th floor with a view of the city, wonderful. The hotel is centrally located one block from City Hall. The room was lovely , large, very nice bathroom, comfortable bed. We were able to get a continental plus breakfast on the 31st floor, a very nice perk. The concierge recommended two restaurants and made reservations for us. We enjoyed both. All the hotel staff were very nice and helpful. We were also able to leave our bags in a locked room off the lobby until we left to catch our train at 4:30 PM. We would definitely return.
ReviewTitle: Grand hotel in the heart of Philly

ProviderLocation: 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: To get the negative point out the way first I'd say the room was in need of some slight refreshing and renovation. This however was a small factor and there are many positives that made our stay very enjoyable. The hotel is certainly popular with business travellers but it never felt too crowded in the lobby and around the hotel. The hotel restaurant, Bank & Bourbon is worth a visit for food and/or drink anytime of the day. The hotel pool is a little on the small side but still adequate. The highlight for me however was the close proximity of the Reading Terminal Market. With so much choice for food, we ventured here at least once a day during our stay. The staff thought the hotel came across as friendly and were very helpful when needed.
ReviewTitle: Great location for Reading Terminal Market

ProviderLocation: 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: Always love going to Loews in center city. Everyone is always considerate and kind. The bartender on night shift named Buntu is a great guy to talk too. We laughed along with the people who came across the street from their hotel the Marriott. We all had a great time.

ProviderLocation: 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: We stayed 2 nights for a wedding celebration in Philadelphia. The accommodations were extremely comfortable, and the service was excellent. Additionally, the restaurant and bar were very convenient and the food and beverages delicious. I would highly recommend staying at this venue.

ProviderLocation: 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: Disappointed because I became insecure about my privacy due to poor communication within the staff. Every time I heard something I was worried a staff member will barge in uninvited. My card didn't work the next day. Apparently you need a new card for each day you're there. The temperature was hard to control. It was hot the whole time I was here. Maybe I just got the bad room.
ReviewTitle: Disappointed because I became insecure about my privacy due to poor communication within the staff

ProviderLocation: 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: Loews Center City has it all. Location, great staff, nice rooms with terrific views. Just across the street from Jefferson Station and the Reading terminal Market. Both City Hall and the Pennsylvania Convention Center are in sight and steps away. Try Bank and Bourbon. It gets crowded and there's a good reason, the menu is top notch.

ProviderLocation: 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: Overall the hotel was nice... The room was clean & the bed was comfy...what I didn't like is there was no microwave or refrigerator to store food or drinks...they did have a refrigerator full of drinks you could purchase by charging them to your room but we never use incidentals anyway...location was key bring that we are from Florida & it was our first trip to Philly!

ProviderLocation: 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: The overall experience was great. The staff was very courteous and professional each day. My only complaint was when I was checking out , It should not take over a week to refund me my deposit. I'm still waiting for my funds to be deposited.

ProviderLocation: 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1200 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: Omg my room had everything I needed. And it made me feel like I had more money then I already have. The customer service was great. It was stylish and very relaxing. I'm thinking to save up for another random stay. I loved it

ProviderLocation: 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: Stayed at the Alexander Inn for 4 nights instead of the two planned originally. Rang the Hotel at 8 pm to let them know we were delayed and Andrew said we did not have a booking. We should have arrived on the Sunday, we had got our dates mixed up. Andrew was brilliant when we arrived at the Hotel at 10 pm very tired. Gave us a lovely room. We loved the place so much we stayed a extra three nights as it was convenient for all the tourist spots. All the staff exceptionally helpful and friendly. Breakfast included in price. Only downside no bar for those of us who like a nightcap before retiring for the night. Plenty of watering holes nearby so it was not really a problem. Also nice quiet area with easy walking distance to the City. A lovely place to stay with very helpful staff. And thanks Andrew for giving us a great first impression as we were very tired when we arrived and a bit upset that we had got our dates mixed up. If we ever return to Philadelphia again we will definitely stay at the Alexander Inn.

ProviderLocation: 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: We stayed here for four nights and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and assisted with restaurant suggestions and travel arrangements. The room was well appointed, clean and had a great view. Thank you John for your hospitality. Hope to be back soon.

ProviderLocation: 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: I started staying here in 2004. It is a small, boutique hotel, reasonably priced, and perfectly located at the corner of Spruce and 12th for walking to Independence Hall, City Hall, and a little further to the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, Barnes Foundation, and the Philadelphia Museum of Art. There are excellent restaurants right outside the hotel. Be prepared for somewhat small rooms and a more "European" style of service than you would get at a standard American chain like Marriott.

ProviderLocation: 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: Alexander Inn is in a great central location in Philadelphia, allowing one to walk most anywhere. It is a bit of a nuisance having to park the car 2 blocks away, but once parked, we never used it until we left the city. Helpful staff, clean rooms, and decent American breakfast.

ProviderLocation: 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: We stayed in the city due to a surgical procedure at Penn Hospital. It was close to the hospital and there were numerous restaurants within walking distance. The room was clean but VERY small/tight. It was adequate for the convenience to the hospital but would not be a first choice for an extended vacation.

ProviderLocation: 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: I come to Philly quite often and stay with a friend near Penn. This time I needed a place as she was unavailable. I stumbled upon the Alexander on Hotels.com and liked the price and the location and the amenities. I appreciated the included continental breakfast, and especially the warmth and humor of the staff. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. I will return (if my friend is unavailable!) :)

ProviderLocation: 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: I loved this hotel. Situated centrally in the heart of the Gayborhood (aka Wash West), I was charmed instantly and felt it had historic, old-world character with a welcoming fireplace and cozy lobby area (where a respectable continental breakfast was served). I thought the fact that they had drinks and a few snacks available day-round a very civilized touch. The neighborhood is great, with lots of things to do within easy walking distance and full of early 13 colonies charm, you could almost picture Ben Franklin walking some of the streets. My only reason for not giving higher marks was that the elevator got stuck at one point and the gym equipment could be updated. If the prices stay reasonable, I'll for sure be back though! I loved the energy of the place!
ReviewTitle: I'll Be Back to This Centrally-Located Gayborhood Hotel Replete with Character

ProviderLocation: 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: This will continue to be my go-to place in Center City. It's easy to get to and well-located for outings on foot. The "pocket-size" room was as boutique as could be. Absolutely no complaints. They've added Continental breakfast (fairly generic) since last time I stayed here; there's also "Toast" (caf√©) right across the street.

ProviderLocation: 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: I revisited this hotel for, what?, perhaps the fifth time. It is still excellent: courteous staff, well maintained and equipped, great location, and above all, a ratio of value-for-the-dollar that is, I think, impossible to beat in downtown Philadelphia. Because it's in a vibrant neighborhood, expect some noise from outside as late as 2, 3, 4 a.m. But hey, that's not the hotel's fault. And the location rewards you with very fine restaurants in the south-of-South-St. neighborhood.
ReviewTitle: Still an excellent hotel, great value

ProviderLocation: 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107 301 South 12th and Spruce Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: I stayed 2 nights while attending a convention. I had one of the twin rooms, which was perfect for one. The front desk staff was always pleasant. The continental breakfast was a nice touch. The staff kept the area nicely stock with breakfast items. The gentleman during the week was great, while the older gentleman on the weekend was a bit grouchy....maybe he was having a bad day...we all have those. I would highly recommend the gem of a hotel.
ReviewTitle: Nice little gem in the middle of the city....

ProviderLocation: 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5115 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5115
ReviewText: We needed a hotel for a quick weekend visit. This was great! In a fun neighborhood- lots of cute restaurants near by. An easy walk to the art museums. The hotel itself was elegant and very comfortable. We had a drink and hamburger in the bar area- good food and very nice, helpful waitress. The concierge was very helpful the next day also. All the staff were exceptionally friendly. We'll be back!

ProviderLocation: 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5115 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5115
ReviewText: The Sofitel is not inexpensive, but you do get what you paid for. They offered a gorgeous, comfortable room. I almost didn't want to leave the bed, since it felt so good! The location is also excellent, a short walk to the Marathon (which was why we were there - my husband ran it), as well as lots of restaurants, museums and shopping. The bathroom was excellent, with a lovely soaking tub with lots of hot water, and a separate shower stall. The amenities in the room were first rate, more than most hotels (things like shoe horns, shoe buffers, plus slippers, robes and other usual items). Two small negatives - there were not enough drawers. Luckily, we were only staying two nights, so it wasn't a real issue. Also, there was no full length mirror in our room, which I thought was a bit odd. The hotel features a lovely bar with good service, nicely appointed with a large selection of beverages and snacks. The bartender was friendly and helpful.

ProviderLocation: 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5115 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5115
ReviewText: We (couple, older people) liked this hotel. It was in the city, near museums and historical sites. There were some small businesses nearby and other food places. It had a real restaurant that served breakfast, lunch, and dinner. 3 friends joined us there for dinner one night and everyone was happy with their meal.

ProviderLocation: 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5115 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5115
ReviewText: Took my wife for a weekend away without the kids to celebrate our anniversary. From the moment we pulled into the valet parking to the front desk, everything was perfect. We upgraded to a beautiful suite. Shortly afterward champagne and treats were delivered to our room, I didn't even remember mentioning that we were celebrating our anniversary. The bed was really comfortable as was the couch. This hotel is too notch, I'll be back!!!

ProviderLocation: 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5115 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5115
ReviewText: Our second stay at this hotel, and it's still as outstanding as two years ago. Special thanks for excellent service by: Eric (front desk) and especially Miguil (breakfast room) and Bubacar (valet). Another doorman (don't recall his name) gave us explicit instructions on how to take the bus to the Mint and even walked us to the bus stop. We stayed in a 14th floor Junior Suite -- wow. Very quiet and good view. To give you helpful specifics: Lanvin toiletries (soap, lotion, body wash, shampoo, and conditioner), along with Qtips, shower cap, nail file and loofah. Fully-enclosed shower; regular (non-jacuzzi) tub with shower wand. Bathroom has electric outlets and plenty of sink space for toiletries. Water pressure good, even on the top floor. Inside the closet is a full-length mirror, an umbrella, ice bucket, corkscrew, wine and regular glasses, and robe and slippers. There's a Keurig coffee maker (and to-go cups). The mini-bar had a tiny bit of space for our drinks. The bed (SO comfortable) is made up European-style (no top sheet), so make a request in advance if you want it otherwise. Our thermostat worked fine; Our booking package included breakfast. During the weekday, we could order anything off the menu; weekend was a good buffet. Loved the bar. We didn't use the Wi-Fi. There's a computer and printer access in the lobby. The hotel has a "Visitor's Channel" on TV, which highlighted tourist attractions nearby. The hotel entrance drop-off is very small, so you may drive past it the first time. Yes, parking is expensive, but includes in-and-out privileges and until 6 pm the day of checkout. Don't know whether any cheaper alternatives are nearby. Next time, we may take the train. For full disclosure, I'm a Platinum-level loyalty member, so part of what made our stay special could have been because of our status. (Note, because of the lack of Accor hotels in the US, it's extremely difficult to become a Platinum member; by the program rule changes, I won't have that status next year. So we'll see if our experience changes next time.) This is only the second-time I've ever given a hotel a perfect score on Trip Advisor. We love this Sofitel and want to go back soon.

ProviderLocation: 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5115 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5115
ReviewText: I enjoyed my recent stay at the Sofitel Hotel. The location was perfect and the hotel was lovely. The staff here were friendly and very accommodating. My room was huge and very clean. Breakfast at their restaurant was very good. I would definitely stay there again if I need to travel to Philadelphia again.

ProviderLocation: 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5115 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5115
ReviewText: I hear he had great taste. Sofitel hotels are wonderful in general, and the Philadelphia location is tops. The concierge service is particularly excellent. Even before my stay, they were in touch about what they could do. They helped me with car rentals, places to eat and making sure the room had exactly what I needed. If breakfast comes with your meal, hit the buffet rather than get room service. Amazing assortment of pastries.
ReviewTitle: Ben Franklin Would Have Loved This Place

ProviderLocation: 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5115 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5115
ReviewText: This is my second stay at the Sofitel Philadelphia Hotel in one year. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and the room was spacious and comfortable. I stayed here on business, and the conference facilities were very nice. The food served during the conference was of very high quality. The only glitch I encountered during my stay was when I went to the lobby lounge to have a cocktail while my room was being made up - I waited 15 minutes and then left because no server came to take my drink order. I let the hostess know this when I left the lounge, and she was very apologetic. The location of the hotel is great. There are lots of restaurants, shops and bars within walking distance, and Bruno's (a great deli/market) is just around the corner. Do check out Dizengoff which is across the street from the Sofitel right by the Hotel Palomar; if you like hummus, you will love this delightful little restaurant. As well, the museum area is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel which makes for a nice little excursion.

ProviderLocation: 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5115 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5115
ReviewTitle: A great hotel at a great value

ProviderLocation: 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia , PA 19103-5115 120 South 17th Street , (City Center West) , Philadelphia, PA 19103-5115
ReviewText: It was a nice welcome on arrival ‚Äì at the reception desk that was, because the doormen were and had been rather nonchalant throughout the stay. I received an e-mail offering a conplimentary late check-out, which was confirmed at check-in, and that was a real plus for me as my train from Philadelphia to Neward for onward flight would not depart until 5 pm. The room was well-appointed and the wifi easy to work with. A nice touch was the adaptor for European electric applicances. Amentities were Sofitel standard. There were however some outages of TV signals on a few occasions and it had taken some time for the water to get hot a couple of times during the entire stay. The hotel is located in the so-called "French quarter" with plenty of restaurants to choose from, which means that I have only tried the breakfast at the hotel. It was √†-la-carte weekdays and a buffet on Saturday, my last day of the stay. The salmon benedict from the menu was excellent ‚Äì cooked to perfection with just the right amount of runniness. The selection of the buffet was more limited compared with other Sofitels, but I like the fact that they had duck slices on the day I was there. The gentleman from Dijbouti was a star and I got the feeling that he really enjoyed and was proud of his work, while other servers were much less alert and everything had to be asked for. I would definitely come back to the Sofitel when in Philadelphia again.
ReviewTitle: Good Sofitel standard at a nice location

ProviderLocation: 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia , PA 19106 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: We stayed in room 302. The historic house is beautiful and charming. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was clean and the bed comfortable. My wife and I came for the weekend and had a nice relaxing visit. Would recommend this hotel to anyone coming for a night or a week.

ProviderLocation: 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia , PA 19106 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: We stayed in room 201 PROS: very clean bathroom was large room was well appointed enjoyed the hotel overall staff was friendly and very helpful complementary wine was a nice touch loved the fireplaces in the common areas centrally located and easy to walk to all of the tourist sites lots of good restaurants nearby CONS: breakfast could have had more fresh fruit or oatmeal (it was kinda sparse) a little noisy when people went by the door (door banged a bit) no parking at hotel Overall had a wonderful experience and would highly recommend when visiting Philly.
ReviewTitle: Great visit to the Philly and Morris House!

ProviderLocation: 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia , PA 19106 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: We went there on a week night because we were attending a whiskey tasting at the Phila Art museum. What a gem, I grew up in Delaware Co and never knew this place existed. Everyone was helpful, friendly and fun. We met the owner carrying flowers to the restaurant. He couldn't have been nicer. The rooms were immaculate, the restaurant was fabulous and I adored the bar maid.

ProviderLocation: 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia , PA 19106 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: What a wonderful hidden gem....totally affordable, beautiful and amazingly hospitable..Close to many nice little restaurants. Very safe area with parking right across the street. I would highly recommend this beautiful hotel that feels like a bed and breakfasts.

ProviderLocation: 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia , PA 19106 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: For our 20th Anniversary we were looking for something special. The Morris House Hotel fit the bill. Very historical and loaded with character & charm. Also, a great value & in a convenient location. Breakfast was included & 4 PM complimentary glass of wine. There's a lovely sitting room with a fireplace (light of course). We stayed in the winter ... a summer visit would be even nicer because there is an awesome courtyard that I want to come back to enjoy. There was coffee, tea & freshly baked cookies available. The only improvements I would suggest are; nicer furniture and better water pressure. However, if you are looking something with more ambience than a hotel room, this is a very good choice!

ProviderLocation: 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia , PA 19106 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: The hotel is basically a converted picturesque colonial residence. I usually do not expect much, but was quite pleasantly surprised by the Morris House Hotel. The room was very spacious with big bathroom, small kitchen area, decently big living room, and separate bedroom. I felt like I was a guest in the colonial residence. The staff were very friendly. There is also a garden for events. The only thing was I could not figure out how to connect to the wifi but I didnt bother much with it. Enjoyed relaxing on the big sofas and watching news on the big TV. Overall I would say this hotel deserves the no. 1 ranking in Philadelphia that it has on TripAdvisor. Would definitely recommend!

ProviderLocation: 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia , PA 19106 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: This hotel is comfortable and cozy with a very helpful staff and delicious (warm) cookies and tea in the afternoon, just when a pick-me-up is needed. The location in center city makes for easy walking to many attractions and shopping, and public transit is also easily accessible. There is NO noise in the rooms (at least mine on the third floor.) Continental breakfast is plentiful and can be enjoyed in the charming outdoor courtyard.
ReviewTitle: One night stay was just right.

ProviderLocation: 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia , PA 19106 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: The Morris House Hotel has to be the most perfect stay you could experience. The soft eloquence and charm of the nearly 230-year old hotel will surely draw in anyone, not just your history lovers and romantics. This hotel is a small boutique hotel with just 15 rooms. Each room is unique and there are suites available as well. Wonderful for a business stay, family stay, or personal stay and great for all occasions! Located in the heart of historic Philadelphia there are numerous sites to see and places to explore right around the corner from the Morris House Hotel. DEFINITELY a must. The staff and management of this hotel are superb. Their attention to detail and genuine sincerity is refreshing in an age where these things are hard to come by. A wonderful down to earth place (with down to earth people) tucked away from a bustling city.
ReviewTitle: A Wonderful Place Anytime of the Year

ProviderLocation: 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia , PA 19106 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: The staff at this hotel were just good people. They care about their guests and it shows. The rooms are quiet and comfortable. I was in Philly on April 9-10 and it snowed on the 9th. The fireplaces in the hotel made drying out pleasant and made the stay even more comfortable. The smell of coffee is heavenly. Especially in the cold. Easily the best place to stay. You won't regret it.

ProviderLocation: 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia , PA 19106 225 S. 8th St. , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Stayed a couple of nights at the end of a business trip to the US. A very nice, small, quaint hotel. I had a room on the top floor which was of a good size and was well decorated. You can help yourself to hot drinks in the lobby through the day, and cookies are provided in the afternoons. A self service breakfast buffet was included but I found it fairly limited - I would have liked more hot items to choose from. However, would definitely stay again if I were in Philly. Short walk to nearly all the main tourist sites.

ProviderLocation: 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia , PA 19106 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Our room was a beautiful boutique style room with a mini balcony overlooking Old City and the river. We were steps from the Betsy Ross house, cooks row and public transportation if you aren't interested in driving. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They gave us great recommendations for a quick bite to eat, how to get around the city and whatever else we were wondering about. I highly recommend the hotel. The parking facility that they contract with next door were not nearly as impressive.

ProviderLocation: 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia , PA 19106 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: We stayed at Penn's View on a quick overnight trip to the city. The location is great, the hotel is charming and clean, and the customer service excellent. We stayed in a deluxe queen with river views, a fireplace, and jacuzzi tub (Rm 500). The rooms are quite small, but have a wonderful historic charm and warm ambiance. Room 500 was great because it is set apart from the other rooms. The one draw back is that it is right next to the elevator so you have potential noise there (I was awakened quite early by folks chatting as they waited for the elevator to arrive). We parked right next door to the hotel (Patriot Parking lot). We prepaid with Parking Panda for a slight discount. It took them a bit to move other vehicles that had been parking in front of ours when it was time for us to leave Sunday afternoon, but the parking location was extremely convenient and easy. I don't really have any complaints. If I were to be super picky, I guess I could say that the continental breakfast isn't anything to write home about. Pretty basic (cereal, toast/bagels/muffins, boil-your-own-egg station, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal), but certainly enough to get our day started and hold us over until lunch. Worked for us!
ReviewTitle: Looking for something with great location and character? This is the place!

ProviderLocation: 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia , PA 19106 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a romantic weekend getaway. We actually ended up extending our stay by another night as we were enjoying the hotel and our visit so much. Antonio and his staff are professional, courteous and accommodating. Breakfast is good. The panorama restaurant is also excellent. We are definitely planning a return visit. I would highly recommend this hotel.

ProviderLocation: 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia , PA 19106 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Our room on the 5th floor was smallish but very pretty and cozy. We had a view of Market Street with its shops and restaurants; of course that came with a bit of street noise, easily countered by turning on the fan. The bathroom was small but very well laid out. And the bed was so comfortable! My only complaint is the bedding--it feels synthetic. But I slept wonderfully nonetheless. The food at the Panorama Ristorante is excellent, and the wine program very interesting. The bartenders are fun and chatty, as are others at the bar. Go early and have fun!
