ProviderLocation: 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia , PA 19106 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Planned a getaway with my husband to Philadelphia to help destress from the upcoming holidays. We stayed at the Penn's View Hotel. Our room was top floor with fireplace overlooking the water. The service was great and the room booking came with continental breakfast. The main issue was the phone did not work and there was no hot water. It was very frigid when we went and not having a warm shower was an inconvenience. Maintenance addressed the issue 24hrs later however, we missed a whole day of showers, relaxing, and using the tub. The location of the hotel is great, close to bars, etc. Would def come back and would recommend to others.

ProviderLocation: 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia , PA 19106 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Very classy hotel I would say, gave me a vintage vibe for some reason. I love how everything was organized. The staffs were nice, and the service was great. I could not ask for more! This definitely added point to the awesomeness of Philly!!!

ProviderLocation: 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia , PA 19106 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: I chose this hotel after seeing many great reviews, and I wasn't disappointed, it's a lovely quaint old hotel, if you want modern go somewhere else, I love the rustic charm. Some say the location is too far away from the centre of the city, but I disagree it's right on Market street which is a pleasant stroll, I found everything I needed, there are some great restaurants around the hotel, plus Panorama which is in the hotel itself. The hotel is near the 95 freeway but I was on an inside room with no view, but it was very quiet and didn't hear the noise from the freeway. The bed was very comfy and the room clean it had everything I needed, with one exception and my only complaint (apart from there being no small fridge, but that seems to be the norm in hotels these days) there was no lounge chair to sit in to watch tv, I had to lay on the bed which is not good because I kept falling asleep, my suggestion is to install a lounge chair I believe the room is large enough for one. Continental breakfast is included and it's actually one of the best ones, it has the usual toast, cereal, fruit, orange juice, coffee etc, but they did have a place to boil your own egg which is a great idea. I happily recommend this hotel to anyone they have free WIFI which is very good speed, the only annoying thing is having to sign in each time I started my laptop up, it was hard to find the login page again. I have had a very happy stay at this hotel and would consider returning in the future.
ReviewTitle: Lovely stay in a quaint hotel

ProviderLocation: 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia , PA 19106 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: I was in the city just for the night. The hotel was perfect. Nice rooms and comfortable bed. Cute bathroom in a room for one. There's an elevator and it has a great view of the river. It has a public parking lot right next door, it's $26 for overnight, which is a little pricey but parking in that area is not easy (I used to live in the city) and the lot gives you a ticket with a bar code you can scan and exit and re-enter with very little trouble. There's subway stop three blocks away and you're in a great neighborhood for walking around. They also offer a complimentary breakfast every morning. Highly recommend!!

ProviderLocation: 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia , PA 19106 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: I enjoyed a "me-cation" in Old City recently. I stayed in Rm 314 Jacuzzi King with view. This is a room with a "loft" kind of feel. The room was luxurious, spacious, and cozy. The SPA BATH was phenomenal... Antonio and Christian were hospitable. The hotel is less than a block away from the Market-Frankford line, and 3 stops away from regional rail connection. I was able to unwind, enjoy some me time, and do some shopping. Please visit this hotel if you like to feel at home while you are away from home.

ProviderLocation: 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia , PA 19106 14 North Front St. & Market , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: This hotel is listed as a historic building, and that gives it some limitations on interior space. However it is a quaint and comfortable establishment, with a very good location on the edge of the old part of Philly. There are plenty of bars and restaurants within easy walk. Central Philly is quite close. Rooms are very clean, simply furnished and (provided that you are not at the front) quiet. It does not really work as a business hotel, but if you are looking for a high-value place for a couple of days' downtime, this is a great choice.

ProviderLocation: 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19104 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19104
ReviewText: The hotel is centrally located with a terrific panoramic view of the Philadelphia's skyline. The hotel is close to and host to wonderful restaurants. Indian, Chinese, Japanese sushi plus typical American cuisine within walking distance. The staff is knowledgeable about their city and keen to share. Rooms are quiet and dispite being in the heart of the city we (16th floor) slept soundly. No pool but a well furnished exercise room.

ProviderLocation: 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19104 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19104
ReviewText: This hotel is clean, convenient, and the staff is friendly. Chef Michael made us a delicious breakfast, and Sasha Lampon kept our room clean and well stocked. The room was beautiful, the bed comfortable, and the locations is extremely convenient. Right off the highway and just a few minutes walk from the 30th street station. Will definitely stay here again.

ProviderLocation: 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19104 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19104
ReviewText: We stayed in the city for a nice get-a-way, and it was a pleasure! The staff was fast and efficient, and breakfast in the club lounge was even better! Chef Michael was pleasant, and Yasena (I think that's how you spell it) was a joy! We would definitely come back again.

ProviderLocation: 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19104 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19104
ReviewText: Arrived in the snow before check in and were able to pay to upgrade to Club and the room was ready. Woman at check in was terrific! Met friends at the bar after the basketball game and it was nice. The room was good and bed comfortable as always. Had a wonderful omelet made the next morning by Michael. My only question is as a Gold SPG - were we supposed to be charged $ to upgrade to Club since rooms were available? Greatr location - would stay there again.

ProviderLocation: 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19104 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19104
ReviewText: We stayed on the Club Level and were very happy with the comfortable, roomy accommodations and delicious made-to-order omelet by Chef Michael in the morning. Close to a number of cool pubs. Good value!

ProviderLocation: 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19104 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19104
ReviewText: Enjoyed my visit! The hotel is in a great location, easy access to the city. The rooms and lobby were clean and the staff was very friendly. Tammy, at the front desk, in particular went out of her way to help. She is a gem!

ProviderLocation: 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19104 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19104
ReviewText: The location is conveniently located, and there are many options for dining. The Asian food restaurant is amazing! Authentic Asian food. The room was clean and well equipped with everything I needed. The beds and pillows are super comfortable. Ron, the right hand man, and Brie, the manager, were absolutely the best! I had a printing request, and Brie went out of her way to help with the issue! Ron also did his best to try and help with the printing, and he was super personable and friendly. ' I will be staying here for the remainder of my stays in University City as long as Ron and Brie are here!

ProviderLocation: 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19104 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19104
ReviewText: I got a great rate, and upon check-in I learned that I had been upgraded to the Club level, which includes a free breakfast. Chef Michael prepared a wonderful omelette to order. I was well rested for my meeting ... the bed was very comfortable, and I loved the pillow ... I'll definitely stay here again if I am coming to Philly.
ReviewTitle: Nice hotel, conveniently located, comfortable bed, great omlette, nice staff

ProviderLocation: 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19104 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19104
ReviewText: Ms. Bre the Front Desk Clerk check me in of Sunday December 4th which was my Birthday and gave me a wonderful upgrade of me using the Complimentary Gift Certificate and the room was spectacular and spacious and felt like i was home. Ms. Bre deserved great excellence of her service and was my First time at a Sheraton Hotel. Also The Club Lounge Server Tammy was also fabulous and was upbeat and we had a marvelous conversation during the last minute of breakfast which was close of shutting down and she was able to ensure I help myself to anything I needed. The best Birthday experience ever and I will definitely return back in the future. These 2 Ladies of Front Desk Bre and Club Lounge Server Tammy In-peck-able service will not go un-noticed.

ProviderLocation: 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19104 3549 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19104
ReviewText: I called multiple times to inquire about the purported discount for medical students taking step 2 CS, but was met each time by a supposedly clueless staff member that had never heard or step 2 or the USMLE or any discount. Upon arrival, I was asked what my stay was for; interview, test, etc. I said step 2 CS, and the lady at the front desk said "we love step 2 test takers here!" - Staff is probably told to pretend they don't know about step 2 so you don't get a discount. Ridiculous.

ProviderName: Home2 Suites by Hilton Philadelphia - Convention Center, PA
ProviderLocation: 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-2816 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-2816
ReviewText: Exceptionally courteous and helpful staff, particularly front desk hostess Ms. Shakiran. Clean, crisp room with a kitchenette, including a dishwasher, microwave, and full-sized fridge. I needed some extra Keurig K-cups and called the front desk to request some. Within ten minutes, answering a knock on the door, I found two young ladies from housekeeping, each with a double handful of K-cups. The staff genuinely seems to genuinely enjoy making their guests feel welcomed. Highly recommended.
ReviewTitle: Outstanding staff. Clean rooms. Excellent security

ProviderName: Home2 Suites by Hilton Philadelphia - Convention Center, PA
ProviderLocation: 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-2816 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-2816
ReviewText: My wife and I enjoyed an overnight stay here while attending an event at the Philadelphia Convention center. Getting to the hotel was very easy from the suburbs and our GPS had no issue finding the hotel or parking garage directly next to the hotel. Upon arrival I was greeted with a friendly smile and greeting from the front desk staff. The gentleman was very helpful and very welcoming. Our suite was immaculate! So clean, and fabulous amenities. Finally, the location is fantastic if you plan on visiting the Reading Terminal market or the convention center. We will certainly be back next year...if not sooner! Highly, highly recommend!!!

ProviderName: Home2 Suites by Hilton Philadelphia - Convention Center, PA
ProviderLocation: 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-2816 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-2816
ReviewText: I love the staff and all of team they are amazing and accommodating I can say Thomas and Carey are fun and helpful and nadira and shakiera are lovable and kind and the security are so official. My boyfriend has never been at home2 and his 1st impression is they deserve a 20!! I'll be coming back next week and hope to get treated the same

ProviderName: Home2 Suites by Hilton Philadelphia - Convention Center, PA
ProviderLocation: 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-2816 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-2816
ReviewText: Nadira, an employee, is amazing !!!! Ask for her ! This was my second time coming to this hotel and it's location is great ! It's within reasonable price and the price is worth what you pay! I love Philly !

ProviderName: Home2 Suites by Hilton Philadelphia - Convention Center, PA
ProviderLocation: 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-2816 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-2816
ReviewText: I booked a room for one night. The location is fantastic, there is so much in walking distance, and I was there specifically for an event at the convention center so it was very convenient. I booked a queen, but I could swear it was smaller than a queen, because I have a queen at home. Everything else was great, the breakfast was wonderful. The staff are super friendly.

ProviderName: Home2 Suites by Hilton Philadelphia - Convention Center, PA
ProviderLocation: 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-2816 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-2816
ReviewText: The only good thing was the location. Right in the heart of the city, although noisy. But I had earplugs so oh well. The beds weren't comfy at all. They were the kind with cheap mattresses that's edges flew up when you got into it. They should invest in pillowtop. Plus, the comforter gave me a rash. I can only guess it was the comforter because I felt something pinching me and when I looked there was no bugs. The staff were polite and pleasant and the pool looked like scummy pond water, even though it was indoors. I've never seen an indoor pool look so opaque with white specks floating on it. Sad. If you can over look the beds and pool and breakfast (which was the saddest thing ever) you ought to give it a try. I'll be trying somewhere else since beds are a big thing with me...

ProviderName: Home2 Suites by Hilton Philadelphia - Convention Center, PA
ProviderLocation: 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-2816 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-2816
ReviewText: Ironically, Afterthoughts was also the name of a cocktail I ordered at the Lowe's hotel bar two blocks from this Home 2 Suites. As a "Suites" Homewood and other similar chains under the Hilton group are better than this Home 2 Suites. On the street level Parking at 40 N. 12th is a city parking structure with no marking indicating it as the Home2Suites parking. Despite the updated decor in the loby and the room, the room is a rectangular space with wasted room configuration. The fridge in the room is butted against the entrance wall right next to the door. The bed is lumpy and cheap, and the pillows must have been stuffed with the same stuffing as my dogs toys. It is so soft and provide no support whatsoever. Also, The ipod IHome docking is not compatible with iphone 6 and up. Lastly, busses started to get moving around 5 AM. The sounds can be heared all the way on my 9th floor room in this hotel. With all of those things in mind I think I will stay somewhere else the next time I'm in Philladelphia. I am almost certain the homeless who sleeps on the street around this location have better sleep with firm neck support than those the Home 2 suites called pillows.

ProviderName: Home2 Suites by Hilton Philadelphia - Convention Center, PA
ProviderLocation: 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-2816 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-2816
ReviewText: Because this is a "fancy" name I expected a little bit of attitude from the guests and staff...WAS I WRONG! Staff could not have been more accommodating and friendly. They made me feel special and important! Came in for just one night and could have stayed a week. Room was large with a kitchen utensils, plates - everything i needed! Modern, clean, beautiful! Area was great - walked to many places and Reading Terminal Market was right across the street! Can't wait to stay at this brand and location again. Highly recommend!

ProviderName: Home2 Suites by Hilton Philadelphia - Convention Center, PA

ReviewText: Hotel is just steps from the Jefferson stop on the regional train line from the airport and 2 minutes from city hall and down town/convention center - really well located centrally. nice new accomodations - good sized suite with well stocked kitchen area and I love the shower - nice to see new hotels with out the ubiquitous and redundant bath.

ProviderName: Home2 Suites by Hilton Philadelphia - Convention Center, PA
ProviderLocation: 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-2816 1200 Arch St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-2816
ReviewText: We were there for a surgery because of the deal for Will's Eye Hospital. Designed for potential extended stay, the suite is very clean and fully functional. With a mini kitchen and comfortable furniture, the hotel is very modern without being luxurious. The breakfast is varied options but hot items are processed packages with microwaves.

ProviderLocation: 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: George is a humorous guy who can make you laugh at the first moment you enter the hotel. Check-in was fast and efficient. Great!! The room we got in the really nice, things are clean and tidy, the most important is, it is right in the middle of the city. What a great location they have got!
ReviewTitle: Front receptionist George made a great first impression to me in Philly

ProviderLocation: 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I have stayed at this Sonesta twice and enjoyed my stay both times. It is reasonably priced, centrally located, clean and comfortable. The staff are attentive and friendly and there is parking on site(although a bit pricey). The food is good and although your choices are limited, there are many great restaurants within walking distance, including Ruth Chis in the same building.You are also in walking distance of many local attractions, such as Franklin Institute, etc. I would stay there again, while visiting Philadelphia.

ProviderLocation: 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: Me and my boyfriend stayed at Sonesta for 3 days and 2 nights and it was amazing! From the moment we arrived the staff was very nice and accommodating. The location of the hotel was perfect because it was walking distance to all of the attractions Philadelphia has to offer. We asked the front desk if it was possible we could get a late checkout and they offered it without hesitation. I will absolutely stay in Sonesta again in the future and will recommend it to anyone I know that visits Philadelphia!

ProviderLocation: 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: We spent the weekend in Philadelphia and stayed at the Sonesta. It was perfect in every way. The room was spacious, VERY clean, and quiet. The hotel is centrally located to everything...restaurants, shopping, historic sites...everything. For first time visitors, we couldn't have selected a better place to experience the City of Brotherly Love. Highly recommend.

ProviderLocation: 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: We had a great last minute weekend trip to Philly, Sonesta sent a promo offering a discounted rate to experience the hotel. Very impressed. The hotel is modern without being cold, the decor is nice, the staff great. We rarely pay for valet parking, but it was worth it at this hotel given how little street parking there is in the city. The lobby bar was tons of fun as well, highly recommended.

ProviderLocation: 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I'm not impressed at all by this hotel. I can't believe they actually have a 4 star rating. I arrive to check in and they can't find my reservation. It wound up being a dumb mistake and I was standing around waiting for too long for them to resolve the issue. I get to the room, and I'm sorry but this just isn't 4 star hotel decor material. Everything looks old and beat up not crisp and clean. The walls look like they belong in a 1 star motel, and I'm paying 4 star prices? Really? Will never stay here again.
ReviewTitle: Not impressed. This is so not a 4 star hotel.

ProviderLocation: 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I reserved this hotel through Hotels.com, paid $375/night CAD all in and stayed 2 nights. This hotel advertises itself as a "luxury" hotel, it is a renovated apartment building well located near Rittenhouse Square (which as you will read is it's best feature). Upon arriving at my room, I immediately notice how small it was, so much that I immediately go searching for the picture on hotels.com: nowhere close to the pictures. Takes not even 1 hour to realize that on top of being smaller than advertised, they gave me the worst room of the floor: right in front of elevators where everybody gathers and speaks as if nobody is around. Add to that that ALL room doors have a huge gap on the bottom so you will hear not only hallway conversations but the incessant slamming of doors. Not the hotel's fault that people have no manners and voluntarily slam doors but hotel's responsibility to mitigate by installing springs behind doors. After realizing I would pay $375/night to sleep in worst conditions than in a tent, I inquired with front desk to change rooms. The clerk informed me that yes, I should expect this type of small rooms because I reserved through hotels.com and they give out their worst rooms to people who reserve through those (aka rack rates) however he understood when I showed the gap at bottom of door and noise from being in front of elevators. He changed my room immediately and at that point, I would have been satisfied. Unfortunately, only when arriving at second room did I realize ALL rooms have door gaps at the bottom therefore the slamming would not stop (again, remember that you're paying $375/night for having the privilege of hearing people slam doors, including room cleaners in the morning who scream at each other in front of your door AND make it a point to slam doors like there was no tomorrow). Icing on the cake, there was a dog left barking next door by it's owner (not the hotel's fault) even though hotel is not pet friendly. Even though I reported it to front desk on 3 separate instances over 6 hours, I paid $375/night to hear a dog bark next to my room (their responsibility to deliver a quiet environment). On a final note, the cleanliness of the room was the worst I have experienced in years and I will let you look at the pictures to draw your own conclusions, nothing else to add. In the end, worst $750 I have spent all year and staying at this hotel certainly contributed to my worst weekend of 2016. Hope I can save you the trouble and heartache of having to constantly battle with management to get a minimum of value for my hard earned money. This hotel certainly takes their clients for granted, fool me once, shame on you. Instead of writing me excuses, simply try to deliver a basic hotel experience to your clients, I just gave you all that is wrong with your hotel.
ReviewTitle: Avoid at all costs, bad value

ProviderLocation: 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: Room services was very good, Info and reception excellent. at 22nd floor with excellent view of downtown.room decor very clean and quiet. I'm already exited to come back with my family. Very relaxing!

ProviderLocation: 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: Hotel was modern and stylish and up to date. Bed was super comfortable. Rooms very clean. Friendly staff. Gentlemen helped me carry my bags to my room due to an injured back. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to stay in the general area.

ProviderLocation: 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1800 Market Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I stayed at the hotel for three nights. The location was great, close to shopping & restaurants. The room was very spacious with a very comfortable bed. The customer service is absolutely phenomenal. There are two sisters, Nachele & Sadira, who work for room service who are incredibly nice and accommodating. They greet you with a big smile and genuine friendliness. Everyone at the front desk was helpful, particularly George who was nice enough to actually come up to my room and help me log on to the hotel wi-fi. Kudos to management for selecting such a great staff.

ProviderLocation: 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia , PA 19118 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia, PA 19118
ReviewText: This hotel was lovely and the staff were very helpful and accommodating. It was recently renovated and very clean. This seems like an odd thing to say but the bathroom is gorgeous-- all white marble. The hotel is charming--it has modern amenities but the service and the feel makes it seem as you are in a different era. Morning breakfast included pastries, toast, bagels, cereal, oatmeal or waffles. There was fresh juice, as well as coffee and tea. At one of the restaurants downstairs, the food was delicious and the portions were enormous.

ProviderLocation: 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia , PA 19118 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia, PA 19118
ReviewText: This hotel is extremely welcoming and comfortable. Our one bedroom suite with separate living room with pullout sofa meant we could have our 3 small nieces and nephew over for the ultimate sleepover. They were enchanted by the private 2nd floor lobby that had a chess table set up right outside our door. The bed was very comfortable and made up with a cozy down-type quilt, perfect for the awful rainy, blustery cold weather that predominated during our visit. Location is right on Germantown Ave, the virtual Main Street of Chestnut Hill. Perfect for noodling around the avenues many shops, restaurants and galleries. Parking is conveniently located out the back door, in a lot that is shared with a former farmers market that seems to be morphing more into a tourist attraction. But it's a convenient place to grab a latte and a donut from the charming couple at Poppy's Cafe. (The market is only open Thurs- Sat and the cafe Thurs-Sun). Continental Breakfast is included in the hotel rate and self-served in a beautifully appointed room off the lobby. It's a cozy, peaceful place to read the morning papers, but the actual offerings are such that I'd rather pay a few dollars less and find my own coffee and breakfast. Two good restaurants are located on either side with interior doors so you can avoid the weather, with our favorite being Paris Bistro and Jazz Cafe. This place is so irresistible that we've already booked our next stay. And if you're lucky enough to have Michelle at the desk, you'll likely get a warm hug along with the efficient service. She seems intent on making your wishes come true, and for us, visiting for family medical reasons, she made all the difference in the world.

ProviderLocation: 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia , PA 19118 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia, PA 19118
ReviewText: We were placed on the second floor in the front of the hotel on Germantown Ave. I was concerned that the street noise would keep us up. However the room was configured with a living room on the street side with a separate, doored bedroom behind it. The living room served as a buffer and we slept very well. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. There were 2 TVs and the living room was large enough to allow us to entertain several guests. The Nespresso machine was a very nice touch for early-morning coffee. They had a respectable continental breakfast served in a lovely dining room. The receptionist and other personnel were very friendly and accommodating. The price we paid was very reasonable and it included free parking, pretty good for being relatively close to the city. My only gripe was that the carpets were a bit worn and the elevator really needed sprucing up. Other than that, I would highly recommend it and will be coming back.

ProviderLocation: 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia , PA 19118 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia, PA 19118
ReviewText: What a delightful stay we had in this charming and jewel-like small hotel in Philadelphia. Our room was lovely, with our every need anticipated (including an umbrella, should the weather surprise us), with tasteful appointments. We enjoyed an excellent meal and unexpected live jazz in the cozy downstairs bar before our evening out. Next time we visit, we plan to stay more than one night, both to explore the village surrounding the hotel, and to spend an evening listening to music downstairs from our room!

ProviderLocation: 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia , PA 19118 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia, PA 19118
ReviewText: The booking process got a little messed up, but they were very responsive. Other than that, it was a very nice room in a great area. Unfortunately we stayed there mid-week when there was not much open for breakfast, but the front desk staff was very helpful in suggesting some options (breakfast at the local pizza joint - who knew?) Looking forward to staying there again and exploring the area some more!

ReviewTitle: The Chestnut Hill Hotel Great Experience!

ProviderLocation: 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia , PA 19118 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia, PA 19118
ReviewText: I needed a hotel just for 1 night due to a fire near my home a few miles away. I have eaten at the fantastic restaurants attached to the hotel many times however I never thought about staying. The hotel is located in beautiful Chestnut Hill next to historic Germantown on the very quaint Germantown ave.about 20 mins drive to downtown. The neighborhood is one of Philly's best .I was pleasantly surprised by this fantastic hotel. I stayed in the postal building annex which is recently updated. You walk up 15 steps; I have knee issues but no problem with my small luggage. The room was large, clean & modern. My room had cozy amenities; nice bed, shower, Nespresso machine & fridge. In the morning a very nice breakfast in the main hotel; the hotel is over 100 yrs old but is impeccably renovated. Parking & wifi are free; there is a great market across the street. Finally, the cool registration woman was very nice & helpful-really great staff. Hopefully you'll have warm weather to sit on the large porch & watch the rhythms of the city. Its a little bit bed & breakfast/hotel in a great setting.

ProviderLocation: 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia , PA 19118 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia, PA 19118
ReviewText: I spent the night here when daughter my daughter was in the hospital. I was by myself so the fact that my room was quite small was not a problem. I think I actually booked the last room in the inn so the other rooms are probably much larger. A delicious breakfast was served and the room his all the amenities I had expected.

ProviderLocation: 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia , PA 19118 8229 Germantown Avenue , Philadelphia, PA 19118
ReviewText: I stayed at the chestnut hill hotel when in the area for a class reunion. What a quaint and friendly place. I enjoyed staying right in Chestnut Hill in a hotel that fit in with the surroundings. So much nicer than finding the nearest suburban chain hotel. Room was nice. The hotel was quiet and I enjoyed the amenities like the bathrobe and umbrella (which I used when I went for a walk in the drizzle on Germantown avenue). The Nespresse coffee machine in the room was a nice bonus too. The hotel had a bed and breakfast type feel to it (for example: book library and chess table on the hotel floor) but it definitely was a hotel. The included breakfast was fabulous. There was still the obligatory Belgium waffle iron that you flip....but you seat yourself in a lovely dining room with china and linen napkins. And the "continental breakfast" selections were varied: something for everyone. Hotel staff was friendly and welcoming. Free parking was another nice perk. I'd come back and stay again in a heartbeat, in fact I hope to.

ProviderLocation: 201 S Columbus Blvd , Philadelphia , PA 19106-3101 (Formerly Hyatt Regency Philadelphia at Penn's Landing) 201 S Columbus Blvd , Philadelphia, PA 19106-3101 (Formerly Hyatt Regency Philadelphia at Penn's Landing)
ReviewText: The Hilton at Penn's Landing is the best option for travelers in the downtown area of Philadelphia. The cost, accommodations, service and location by historical Old Philadelphia and the river cannot be matched by other properties in the area or Center City. I would highly recommend this hotel.

ProviderLocation: 201 S Columbus Blvd , Philadelphia , PA 19106-3101 (Formerly Hyatt Regency Philadelphia at Penn's Landing) 201 S Columbus Blvd , Philadelphia, PA 19106-3101 (Formerly Hyatt Regency Philadelphia at Penn's Landing)
ReviewText: The Hilton Philadelphia at Penn's Landing has it's plus and minuses, but certainly needs to focus on improved service. As a Diamond member I checked in via the App, reserved a room and requested digital key. I arrived early and valeted the car and checked my bags, as it was early, and then went for a walk in Philadelphia for 5 hours. At 1:30 I received a message that my room was available and went back to get my bags and check in at 2pm. Unfortunately, I think I disturbed the woman on the front desk, and distracted here from her cell phone. She could not find my name in the system. I gave her my room number, she could not find my room. She asked a colleague to assist. She did not welcome me as a Diamond member. She did not inform me about the Executive Lounge. She did not offer any upgrade. I showed her the Valet card and the checked baggage tags, and she directed me to the Concierge, who the had to call the bellhop. She went straight back to her iPhone. This is not the level of service that anyone should have to experience, after paying the price for this Hilton. I went to the room and then came back down. She was still checking her iPhone. Not sure what the policies here are, or how they are enforced. The hotel itself is reasonable for a Hilton, with respect to the rooms and cleanliness. Rooms are good, but still not sure what Hilton Honors level is like. The Keatings Rope & Anchor Bar is well located on the river side of the hotel with good views over the river. The staff here are quite helpful. In the morning I went down for breakfast, and found the Executive Lounge (on my own). Walked in and just helped myself. There is no key entry, no staff in the lounge or monitoring. There were staff somewhere, as they were very loud laughing and yelling in the room next door. Finished breakfast, and went to get my car back from Valet. Waited outside in freezing weather, and there was nobody there at 7am. Eventually someone turned up, with a coffee in hand and apologized. He had been standing in the corner of the bar area talking while I was waiting outside. The hotel has a great location, and the rooms are reasonable for a Hilton, where I expect quality, but the service really sucks. If this hotel wants to call itself a Hilton and charge the rates commensurate with the Hilton logo, then they seriously need to address the values, standards and customer service focus tat comes with this brand loyalty.

ReviewText: Comfortable, clean, efficient, good service, and excellent attention from the Hotel Staff: Concierge (Chris), Bar Staff (Mac), Chef (Sam), Engineer (Adam), Shuttle Driver(Vaughn), and Operator (Charlene).

ProviderLocation: 1628 Chestnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1628 Chestnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: We were put in a nice room which the front service desk upgraded on our arrival. The room was nicely sized except for the bathroom - both my partner and I had issues with the stool being a bit small. The amenities in the lobby of coffee and sparkling water were a nice touch. Our shower curtain was a bit grungey, and we noticed the carpets were a bit dirty. The rooms weren't quite soundproof - we and several other guests commented on the tons of band instruments that seemed to be rehearsing on various floors of the hotel. However, their service staff was very friendly and helpful, and big thanks to Lisa.

ProviderLocation: 1628 Chestnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1628 Chestnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: Booked the Club Quarters at the last minute after deciding to divert to Philadelphia for an overnight stay to watch an NBA game on our drive from New York to Washington. Despite small signage at their actual address the hotel is relatively easy to find. We found the front desk staff to be extremely helpful and our room to be above average comfort wise despite being a little on the small size. Would definitely consider staying here again

ProviderLocation: 1628 Chestnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1628 Chestnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: My fiance and I chose club quarters for a short and sweet getaway a few weeks ago. The rooms were nice, everything was very clean, and the location was perfect. There's so much to do in Rittenhouse so club quarters really was perfect. The best part of our stay though had to be the service. There was one employee in particular who stood out for us and his name is Milton. Milton is so kind, courteous, proactive, thoughtful, and funny. He brought sweets to our room, gave us great restaurant recommendations, and always had accurate directions! It was a chilly week in Philly so we were really happy to never get lost in the cold! I'd definitely stay at Club quarters again.

ProviderLocation: 1628 Chestnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1628 Chestnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: We checked our bags early and they were delivered to our room while we were sight seeing. We checked our bags on our last day and had an easy check in and out thanks to the fully staffed and cheerful front desk. The maid service was regular and unobtrusive. The location was ideal. a short walk from the Suburban train station that brought us to and from the airport. We never took a taxi or other public transportation, walking easily to everywhere we wanted to go, museums, jazz clubs, landmarks and great architecture all around. Not a destination hotel, but my wife and I were not crowded in the comfortable modern room with free bottled water and Kurig (sic) coffee maker. We were not hanging out in the room, but found the 7th floor corner just off the main street to be clean and quiet, just right for recharging. TV channels were very adequate for local and national news and weather. I hope to stay there when I return to Philly. It was the right price the right location and the most comfortable I could have hoped for. There were other amenities we did not sample but we got our boarding passes printed easily and were provided with extra pillows and blankets just as easily. We were glad to come home to the CQ for three nights in February.

ProviderLocation: 1628 Chestnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19103 1628 Chestnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I have stayed at this hotel before and despite this time it not being as clean as it has been in the past and the fifth floor having a funky skunk smell in the hallway I plan on returning. No matter if you are checking in, or coming back from a night on the town there is always someone there with a smile and a good evening is there anything you need? ReviewTitle: Perfect Spot when enjoying the city

Milton, at the front desk greeted me with a smile, was very professional and went out of his way to make sure I have a pleasant stay at the Club Quarters. My room was spotless and my bed was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.
ReviewTitle: Nice hotel and Great customer service

ProviderLocation: 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107-1901 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107-1901
ReviewText: We've stayed here before. We like it. It suits our needs just fine. The facility is showing some signs of wear, and the gym, at 82 degrees this morning, was a tad bit uncomfortable, but the rooms are large, clean and comfortable. I sleep pretty well there. Handsome Companion sleeps very well there (as usual). The staff is very nice and very helpful. It's not a real Starbucks, but a "serves Starbucks". For real Starbucks, go next door to the big Marriott. Great location and easy access in and out of town.

ProviderLocation: 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107-1901 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107-1901
ReviewText: I stayed at the Courtyard Downtown for a quick weekend stay. Parking is expensive so I suggest using the Parking Panda App to find less expensive parking nearby. Just be prepared for a short walk of like 3 blocks. The hotel was very beautiful in the lobby & the staff was nice, the elevators are a little old/slow, but the rooms were clean and we had a beautiful view of the city. The hotel is very close to touristy things. I suggest taking an uber or lyft if you're not familiar with the area. The hotel restaurant was pricey, but there's a Chili's across the street that was great for late night food and drinks. If you're looking for a nice convieniently located hotel, this is it. Also check Groupon before booking. They were running great rates for this hotel.

ProviderLocation: 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107-1901 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107-1901
ReviewText: this was a lovely property right in the center of Philadelphia. we felt safe and comfortable the entire time. rooms were fresh, clean, and everything was easy to get to. would absolutely stay again. thank you courtyard!

ProviderLocation: 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107-1901 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107-1901
ReviewText: My husband and I spent a long weekend at Courtyard Downtown Philadelphia in December 2016. This rather big hotel is within an old Philly state building, which gives it a historical air and glamour. Our double room (queen bed) seemed to have been recently renovated. It was comfortable, normal size (not excessively large), no view (overlooked a parking lot). Perhaps other rooms have a view to the beautiful City Hall, right across the hotel, but not ours. Average bathroom, fluffy towels. Our package included fruit and champagne, buffet breakfast (really good for our "continental" standards), plus late check-out. Elevators are "key-operated" and can get really slow... Location is very good: easy access to City Hall area (Love sign), walking distance to Independence Mall (about 15/20 min), Rittenhouse Square (10/15 min, good lodging location too), and 20/30 min to Art Museum (Rocky Steps), Barnes Foundation (awsome) 20 min., Reading Terminal Market just two blocks away (worth a visit!). Excellent dining and shopping options around Rittenhouse Square, and also some attractive near the hotel (Macy's across the street). On Saturday morning we took the train to Bartram Garden, believing it was a botanical garden, which it is not. However, it was interesting to wander through the woods and the ancient garden on the river bank. Must be lovely in summer, rather than in snowy December... Philadelphia is an interesting city, easily visited in a long weekend and this hotel is a good base for it.

ProviderLocation: 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107-1901 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107-1901
ReviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Philadelphia Courtyard Marriott. The room was ready for our early arrival which we appreciated. It was a lovely room with an extremely comfortable bed. and great view. All the employees were very helpful and courteous. We had dinner one evening in your restaurant and found the meal to be very good. We would definitely recommend you hotel to friends coming to Philadelphia.
ReviewTitle: Great Stau at Courtyard Philadelphia Downtown

ProviderLocation: 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107-1901 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107-1901
ReviewText: This hotel is wonderful from top to bottom. I highly recommend this hotel. Their breakfast buffet is very good deal $20 with really good items including the chef that will cook you omelets to order. And I think I'm in love with the front desk staff. Marriott is the standard Bearer

ProviderLocation: 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107-1901 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107-1901
ReviewText: I was happy to be able to walk to almost every destination on my four day vacation. The hotel being in the city center is defiantly the optimal location for tourists. The furthest walk for me was the Philadelphia Museum of Art and the Eastern State which was about a 2 mile hike, but lots to see along the walk! The hotel room was very clean and nicely decorated! The staff was really kind at the front desk and the coffee bar attendant was really friendly and efficient. The only negative was the indoor spa pool had crumbling concrete which felt like i was sitting on small rocks and the water turned my peach colored bathing suit a blue purple color. Other than that the place is awesome!

ProviderLocation: 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107-1901 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107-1901
ReviewText: I moved here without a booking after being dissatisfied where I had booked into, so staff was helpful. Great location for all attractions and easy to walk to historical areas. Good food areas in hotel. Rooms standard but a reasonable size. Almost next to Macy's

ProviderLocation: 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107-1901 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107-1901
ReviewText: The Courtyard Marriott Downtown Philadelphia in centrally located within walking distance of most major exhibits/attractions. There is no shortage of coffee shops and restaurants in the vicinity. Although I didn‚Äôt have a bad experience, it is somewhat difficult to write this review because there was nothing exceptional about my stay. I reserved a Corner Room for four nights. The room (#900) was spacious with an extremely comfortable queen-sized bed and free standing shower. The room was clean and contained a mini refrigerator. I was a bit surprised that the television offers analog and digital channels. In addition, there is no option to monitor your bill or checkout via television. There is a Starbucks and restaurant located on the Lobby Level which is good because room service is only offered between the hours of 5 pm to 10 pm. The elevators in the building are small and extremely slow. The Fitness Center is decent but no well attended. There were no Lysol wipes to cleanse the equipment before/after usage. The Fitness Center and Conference Hall/Rooms are located in the same area. It‚Äôs weird to have to walk past conference attendees in order to get to/from the elevator especially when they are dressed in business attire and I‚Äôm shots sweating. There was never a wait at the front desk during check in/out. Since City Hall is located across the street from the hotel, it appears that this is a hangout for the local police officers. This wasn‚Äôt a problem for me as it deters uncanny behavior and unsavory characters.

ProviderLocation: 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia , PA 19107-1901 21 N Juniper Street , Philadelphia, PA 19107-1901
ReviewText: Check in was quick and straightforward along with sightseeing tips on a very busy Friday evening. Rooms. Very recently renovated in blues and grey with cherry wood furnishings were easy on the eye and tasteful. Everything worked. Comfortable side chair with ottoman. Comfortable desk chair. Subway tile in bathroom was a refreshing design element. Public spaces: I expect public spaces in historic buildings to be eye popping. The public spaces here were nice, but not particularly interesting nor unique. Location was perfect for a carless stay in City Center Philadelphia. Many restaurants and bars, museums, etcetera were within 5 minutes to 30 minutes walking. 30th Street Train Station was a 25 minute walk. My tip for staying in this hotel: The main lobby and entrance for check in was on the Penn Square/City Hall side of the building. The elevator lobby is very close by. After a rather long wait to go upstairs to my room, I realized that there is another elevator lobby closer to the 13th Street side of the building which was used by far less people.
ReviewTitle: Architecturally significant renovated historical building with pleasant update to rooms.

ProviderLocation: 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19153 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19153
ReviewText: 2 night stay, happy to find hotel had been renovated. larger bathroom, closet was eliminated items found in closet configured on outside wall with curtin blind. only drawback was ac unit fan ran constantly and couldn't be turned off. Awalys happy with the breakfasts.

ProviderLocation: 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19153 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19153
ReviewText: We always love staying at this Hampton Inn whenever we have an early morning flight out of Philadelphia International Airport. The location is very convenient, and the shuttle service to the airport allows us to leave our car parked in the designated Hampton Inn lot and not have to worry about it.
ReviewTitle: Best Place to Stay When Flying out of Philly

ProviderLocation: 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19153 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19153
ReviewText: Clean, classy, great spot. Great breakfast. Free shuttle to airport. Doesn't get any better than that!! Ample, easy parking. Pleasant competent staff. How away from Home. I have stayed here each time I am flying and go just for fun sometimes!

ProviderLocation: 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19153 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19153
ReviewText: I was told that I had a "Late Check-out" of 1:30 pm the next day by the staff on Saturday night. Sunday at 12:45pm, someone walked in on my fiance' and I in the bed! I was NOT happy. The DO NOT DISTURB sign was on the door as well...
ReviewTitle: Cleaning Lady Walked in on Us!

ProviderLocation: 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19153 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19153
ReviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff - hotel very clean - love the new bathrooms -- Hilton Honor specials make this stay very economical The park and ride feature is easier than the off sites parking sites.. And you great breakfast...
ReviewTitle: Great hotel for those early flights

ProviderLocation: 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19153 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19153
ReviewText: The hotel itself is extremely close (within a few minutes) of the airport, and is in a row of a number of other airport hotels. That means there's plenty of competition, and I was glad to meet staff who apparently know this and do their best to be pleasant in every interaction. I was totally satisfied with my stay - the thermostat in the room allows you to set the fan to Auto or On - I need a fan running all night so I love when this can be changed. (sounds simple, but it isn't always the case) The temp was quick to respond to both heat and a/c. Not sure if I just lucked out, but I never heard doors opening and closing anywhere in the hallway so the quiet was appreciated. The room was well-updated and included a coffee maker as well as a mini fridge. Hot shower was great, and the complimentary breakfast was fine with sufficient options. The gal monitoring the breakfast area was super friendly, as was the woman at the desk at the time of checkout. Would absolutely stay again.

ProviderLocation: 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19153 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19153
ReviewText: I stayed at the Hampton as I had an early morning flight out of Philly. I was very satisfied with the accommodations and took advantage of the airport shuttle that the hotel had to offer. The counter staff was very friendly and attentive.

ProviderLocation: 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19153 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19153
ReviewText: When I arrived around 8pm there was no one at the front desk for a couple of minutes. Once the girl arrived she was very nice and recognized me as a Honors member. She did mention in her check in speech that the hotel had a 4 million dollar renovation and that they have "European closets" which I thought was strange. Turns out there are no real closets, just a curtain covering some hangers on the wall. I didn't need the closet for my one night stay so it didn't matter. My biggest complaint about this hotel is that the water in the shower doesn't get hot enough. The sink gets very hot but not the shower. I reported it the night I arrived and it was the same situation in the morning. Small fitness center which has no dumbbells and was quite warm. I'd probably try a different airport property next time.

ProviderLocation: 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19153 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19153
ReviewText: One of the best hotels to stay at staff is very helpful and friendly, they make you feel like family. Rooms are nice definitely somewhere to come and relax. I love it here and encourage them to keep up the great work

ProviderLocation: 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19153 8600 Bartram Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19153
ReviewText: Wonderful hotel with extended parking and shuttle service to the Philadelphia airport. My room was beautiful and comfortable. Free refreshments upon arrival. Easy to find location. Right off of I-95.

ProviderName: The Logan Philadelphia, Curio Collection by Hilton
ProviderLocation: 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia) 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia)
ReviewText: This hotel has gone down hill since it changed from the Four Seasons to the Logan. From the Unruly and vulgar guests staying there to the uncleanliness of the premises-it was just not a nice stay. I will say the staff who brought the luggage and parked the car were VERY nice and proficient. Just doesn't have that "luxury stay" feel.

ProviderName: The Logan Philadelphia, Curio Collection by Hilton
ProviderLocation: 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia) 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia)
ReviewText: Just back from a great weekend away in Philly and a terrific stay at The Logan. Booked a great deal through the Hilton site and managed the booking and check-in via the honours app. Liked how I received a text before check in to see if I had any queries or requests and then again to see how my stay was going during the weekend. Julia at check in was great - very friendly. I loved our spacious room with a terrific view of the fountain and the free library beyond it. Tastefully decorated, very comfortable bed and a well appointed large bathroom. I loved the art all around the hotel and stylish furniture throughout. The fitness room and pool were compact but did the trick as did the salt water pool. Enjoyed Happy hour at Urban Farmer downstairs. Great vibe, excellent food. Didnt see many guests out and about generally..until the fire alarm on Saturday night. What a surprise. Anyway, an apology note for the false alarm was slipped under everyone's door this morning. Great location and perfect for a cozy, romantic, luxe getaway in one of my favorite cities! Back in a heartbeat.

ProviderName: The Logan Philadelphia, Curio Collection by Hilton
ProviderLocation: 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia) 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia)

ProviderName: The Logan Philadelphia, Curio Collection by Hilton
ProviderLocation: 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia) 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia)
ReviewText: This "nice" hotel used to be The Four Seasons. It's lost some of that patina and is just an average urban hotel. Their restaurant--The Urban Farmer--replaced the old bar and cocktail lounge. It's an excellent restaurant and may be the hotel's best feature.

ProviderName: The Logan Philadelphia, Curio Collection by Hilton
ProviderLocation: 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia) 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia)
ReviewText: The Logan was so pleasant and relaxing. Unfortunately I was only there for two days. The bar had very interesting drinks and the lounge was an enjoyable place to socialize. The rooms were very large and comfortable. It is located in a great area, if the weather had been warmer I would have gone for a run.

ProviderName: The Logan Philadelphia, Curio Collection by Hilton
ProviderLocation: 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia) 1 Logan Square , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia)
ReviewText: What did I like the most about the hotel? First off, my room was super quiet, even though I was on the second floor, facing Logan square. I heard virtually no internal or external noise throughout my stay. Second, the lobby, the hallways and all the public areas were decorated in a fresh, creative fashion. Never do I enjoy the common areas more than my room -- but in this case, they were beautiful! In comparison, my room was a bit more ordinary, but overall it was fine. Also, the location was fantastic! It was close to everything I wanted to see in Philadelphia. I took advantage of the exercise room at 5:30 a.m. -- no one was there. I didn't take advantage of the pool, but there is one in the basement. What didn't I like? Well, not much. I thought having to pay for internet in my room was ridiculous, and I made heavy use of the two computers in the LL next to the gym. If the hotel is not going to offer a free breakfast, I say they can at least have free wifi. The only other thing I can quibble with is that the staff are a bit on the removed/distant side. I prefer a warmer environment -- especially as a stranger to this city. Don't get me wrong -- they were professional and did their job, but there was no warmth, and I felt fairly "alone" in this hyper contemporary hotel. Would I come back again? In a heartbeat ...
ReviewTitle: Nice hotel for the price that I paid!

ProviderName: The Logan Philadelphia, Curio Collection by Hilton

ProviderLocation: 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia , PA 19103 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: The SPG brand has a few hotels in the Philadelphia area, and recently, I've stayed at two of them that are about the same price point (the other is Le Meridian). Good: Great tourist location, lots of restaurants, shops, and historic sites within walking distance. The room is clean, average size, the usual Westin level of quality. Staff was friendly, but nothing out of the ordinary. Bad: Parking is expensive and annoying (paid $41 for ~28 hours self park) but thats pretty standing for downtown in a city like Philly. The lobby situation is very awkward. There is an outside entrance, that leads you into an empty lobby. You then take an elevator up to the 3rd floor for the real lobby, and then elevators up there to the rooms. The bar/restaurant doesn't really have any character, it seems like most of the people there are killing time before a flight or got in too late to eat anywhere else. Overall: This is a good clean functional hotel in a good location. There is nothing really exciting about it and it doesn't really have any character. For my money, if I stay at an SPG property in Philly, it will be Le Meridian which just feels cooler at the same price point.

ProviderLocation: 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia , PA 19103 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I've been here twice and I can definitely tell that the Westin cares about their guests. I appreciate the expert skill and natural ability it takes to foster relationships. This property shows it well. The director of front office operations, Mr. Karim Ware, was phenomenal. Thank you for your services. Everyone person I interacted with was very nice. All of them smiled! The Westin exceeded all of my expectations. I will return.
ReviewTitle: Excellent Customer Service. Clean Room. Clean Hotel. Good Location.

ProviderLocation: 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia , PA 19103 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: Stayed here for first time having made dinner reservations at R2L. The staff was friendly and professional from the bellhop to desk clerks. Check in and parking was a easy experience. This is a great location with its connection to Liberty shopping plaza and other center city locations. Has a very nice lobby and bar area that was always active. Room was very clean and larger than many hotels.

ProviderLocation: 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia , PA 19103 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: The hotel is very nice and it's location can't be beat. It is close to almost all of the major attractions and sights in Philly. The only downfall is no pool and a very small exercise facility. Other than that, it certainly met our needs.

ProviderLocation: 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia , PA 19103 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Philadelphia for two nights while visiting Center City. The coworkers of this hotel are very gracious and accommodating. This is also a wonderful hotel for dogs of all sizes! The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The hotel was not overly large, a very comfortable amount of rooms. The lobby bar had great food and drinks. Our dog was very comfortable in his Heavenly Pet Bed, and they accommodated us with food and water dishes for him, as well as waste pickup bags. This hotel is in a great location, just off of Rittenhouse Square. It is surrounded by terrific dining options. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

ProviderLocation: 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia , PA 19103 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: At first walking into lobby with no one there and finding the lift to go one floor up to the lobby felt odd. But after that the front desk staff were highly accommodating and helpful. The room was excellent and the location very convenient. If in Philly again I would stay at this hotel, good value for money.
ReviewTitle: Nice hotel with an odd entrance!

ProviderLocation: 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia , PA 19103 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: Just checked out from here, as I was visiting friends in Philadelphia this weekend. I'll start with the positive/neutral items: - Great location in Center City, incredibly close and within walking distance to Philly's great nightlife and shopping. - I booked using SPG points, and would say that I received tremendous value for the point spend. - Fitness center and bar were on-par with what I'd expect from a Westin property. Kudos to the great customer service and pleasant attitude from all of the bartenders. - Same as above with room in general - fairly on-par with Westin standards. As for the not so pleasant aspects and why I would only rate this property 3 stars: - Bathroom was small and seemed dated - below average from my experiences. - What really detracted from this trip was the general demeanor of many of the staff, and the fact that the property really blew it in terms of delivering the "Westin Weekend" experience. With the exception of the bartenders, none of the staff with whom I interacted were particularly pleasant people - few smiles, seemingly irritated to serve me. Like many folks, I gravitate to Westin properties for quick weekend trips due largely to their "Westin Weekend" promotion. Apparently this hotel was over-subscribed this weekend. When I requested a 4 PM late checkout (I'm a SPG Gold Member), I was curtly informed by one of the staff members that 1:30 PM was the absolute latest available. No apology, no smile. That by itself wouldn't be a big deal - I understand how the industry works, and I would be super irritated if my room weren't available for a 3 PM check-in. However, the hotel staff seemed to go out of their way to passively-aggressively suggest that they wanted folks out of their rooms as soon as possible on Sunday. When I arrived back on Saturday night there was a note from the hotel's general manager informing me that they would not be granting any checkout requests after 12 PM for anybody due to it being a "busy weekend" - and even offering 1,500 SPG points for folks who checked out before 10 AM. When I called the front desk to confirm my 1:30 late checkout, the staff seemed irritated that I even bothered to ask, but said that I was all set. Then this morning, I was interrupted not once, but three times - twice by housekeeping, once by somebody looking to check the minibar - before 1:30, despite having my "do not disturb" sign displayed. Again, it was very clear that they wanted me out as soon as possible to make way for arriving guests. It's quite irritating as a Gold member, as I find it ludicrous to think that this property has hordes of Platinum elites arriving early on Sunday. I'll comment further that I've had similar weekend experiences with other Westin properties, though without the poor attitude experienced here. If Starwood is going to create an entire marketing campaign around the Westin Weekend experience - including a standard 3 PM check out on Sunday - they need to be able to more consistently execute on it. And again, I'm a Gold member - I imagine the general public must be even more consistently disappointed when they expect a slow and relaxed Sunday, only to have the hotel try to push them out of their rooms as soon as possible. Overall, I had a great trip. I actually would book this property again due to the on-par quality, good price-for-value, and great location, and also because I want to give them the benefit of the doubt - this was unusually poor customer service from a Westin, so I'll assume they were just having a bad weekend due to being busier than expected.

ProviderLocation: 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia , PA 19103 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: Booked a room ~10 days in advance, was able to check in upon arrival (at 2 pm) and was on the SPG floor (room 1226). Great overall stay - clean room, GREAT shower - only downside is that I wasn't there longer. Received a bonus 1500 SPG points for checking out by 10 am too. Will definitely stay again for location and service.
ReviewTitle: My new home away from in Philly

ProviderLocation: 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia , PA 19103 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia, PA 19103
ReviewText: I have stayed at 3 hotels near Rittenhouse Square - Palomar, Sofitel and Westin. And the Westin is now my preferred hotel. Its rooms are the largest, most comfortable and most nicely decorated and I heard neither street nor hallway noise. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. There were food options galore a block or two from the hotel. Additionally, I never felt at all unsafe walking there at night. I was very happy with my stay.

ProviderLocation: 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia , PA 19103 99 South 17th St at Liberty Place , Philadelphia, PA 19103

ProviderName: The Franklin Hotel at Independence Park

ReviewText: Franklin Marriott Hotel is located at Independence Park, so within very easy walking distance of major historical sites. We had a corner room, which was quite spacious. ProviderName: The Franklin Hotel at Independence Park

ProviderName: The Franklin Hotel at Independence Park

I would definitely stay at this property again, no issues with anything, a seamless visit.
