ProviderName: The Franklin Hotel at Independence Park
ProviderLocation: 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Great location in the city. Staff was great, very helpful. The facility itself is showing its age. Peeling wallpaper in the bathroom, some kind of stain on the wall. I am sure this was a beautiful place in its day but Marriott needs to do a make over. No drink menu in the bar, concierge lounge was closed. Not what I expect as a platinum elite member.
ReviewTitle: Not bad, hotel is in need of a remodel

ProviderName: The Franklin Hotel at Independence Park
ProviderLocation: 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Excellent location next to independence hall and park. Decorated classically and elegantly. I received a complimentary room upgrade to a park view room with one king bed and one sofa bed. Room was very spacious and provided a spectacular view for historic area. Marriott gold and platinum members received a complimentary continental breakfast with some kinds of fruit, juice, pantries, and oatmeal. Not bad according to the standard of continental breakfast. Parking next to the hotel (Bourse Garage) was just 15 per night. Fitness center was great except for cool pool. So winter is not suitable to swim in this indoor pool. Overall, a pleasant stay.

ProviderName: The Franklin Hotel at Independence Park
ProviderLocation: 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: Love the Franklin. Check in was a breeze and I was early. Given vouchers for continental breakfast as a gold Marriott member. I l love the lounge and stop for a drink after dinner. I will definitely be back.

ProviderName: The Franklin Hotel at Independence Park
ProviderLocation: 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: I visited this hotel only for one night. The location seemed to be a great location right next to the liberty Bell, and Independence Hall. (Due to Hurricane Matthew headed toward my house my visit was cut short.). Anyway the hotel lobby was nice, the room was nice and the bed was comfortable. The shower controls were horrible though. There seemed to be several dinning options in the area. The valet suggested National Mechanics restaurant and bar. (See review for National Mechanics)
ReviewTitle: Nice hotel, parking is a little steep.

ProviderName: The Franklin Hotel at Independence Park
ProviderLocation: 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: I was in the hotel for about 16 hours. Did not eat breakfast or other meals, use wifi, or go to the pool or gym, so I cannot comment on any of that, but hotel is centrally located, has excellent views (although the Monaco rooms at least are certainly better), has excellent staff (checked in by Nina, who was very good, bellmen were also very good), and has large rooms with thoughtful touches (I am a fan of the lighting that includes outlets to make simultaneous device charging and usage easy, and I really appreciated the shoe shine mitt and wipes that the hotel includes in the bathroom amenities), so I would gladly stay here again.
ReviewTitle: Very good over a short stay

ProviderName: The Franklin Hotel at Independence Park
ProviderLocation: 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia , PA 19106 401 Chestnut Street , Philadelphia, PA 19106
ReviewText: I hadn't been to Philly in a long time, and wanted a place central to all the museums and parks, and the Omni was a good choice. I like the location because there are great neighborhoods to explore in every direction. Society Hill is a few minutes away. Rittenhouse Square is a 25-minute walk away, and the South Philly area with Little Italy is about the same distance. Check-in was fast and friendly. Ginger from housekeeping, and especially Jules the concierge who had excellent recommendations for walks and places to eat. My room on the 12th floor was large for a basic room. So was the bathroom. My two minor complaints were some noise from an adjoining room, and the wifi was a bit choppy at times. Otherwise it was very good and I would return.
ReviewTitle: Great location. Great staff. An older hotel.

ProviderLocation: 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast) 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast)
ReviewText: Upgraded to Presidential Suite for our one night in Philadelphia. Lovely, duplex room with spiral staircase, fireplace, two bathrooms, only thing lacking was a bathtub. Parking in nearby garage a challenge, given bad weather. Suggest valet parking for a hotel of this quality. Great staff, friendly and helpful, greeted with wine and cheese in the drawing room, festive way to celebrate the Christmas season!

ProviderLocation: 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast) 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast)
ReviewText: We arrived at the hotel around 4pm on Saturday, New Year's Eve. Since traffic was difficult getting there and parking is off site we opted to valet park the car (additional $8 + overnight parking lot $23). The management was very polite and helpful. They walked us to our room assisting with the luggage. There is a lot of stairs and two buildings that they made one - so it can be very maze like. However, once you figure it out several stairs will being you out to were you wanted to go (there is a small elevator). Our room was on a corner of the building with several windows. One nice amenity was the gas fireplace in the room. Bed was comfortable and bath was clean and modern. At between 5-7:30 they have a cocktail hour in a very pleasant drawing room with wine and cheese. There is a turndown service at 9pm. Breakfast is served downstairs in adjoining dining rooms buffet style between 7:30-11am. Ice can be obtained by calling the front desk and it was brought up right away. The front door is open and staff is on 24 hours in reception. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. We plan on going back in February to stay again.
ReviewTitle: Excellent Boutique Hotel off Rittenhouse Square

ProviderLocation: 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast) 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast)
ReviewText: We found this for a quick romantic overnight in the city, on a quiet side street but a short walk from the park. Small boutique style with a continental breakfast in the basement, but the rooms were well appointed and front desk staff very attentive and nice. Would highly recommend.
ReviewTitle: A little less expensive than the others, small but very elegant and quiet

ProviderLocation: 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast) 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast)
ReviewText: Tucked away on a charming side street, this small hotel is perfect for a quiet stay. Very French in its ambience, the concierge was extremely helpful and professional. The room my husband and I shared was pretty and comfortable with a clean, nicely stocked bathroom. For me, the bed was too soft and I ended up having to sleep, part of the night, on the floor. My husband, on the other hand, slept soundly and found the bed to be cozy and good. Oh well, I have a bad back! Really, it was a great evening and a great room to return to. We would come back anytime!

ProviderLocation: 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast) 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast)
ReviewText: Absolutely adore every detail of this quaint boutique hotel. The decor, location and friendliness can't be beat. Joe and Daniel are sweethearts. The rooms and bathrooms are upscale and immaculate. Will be back soon!
ReviewTitle: Union League Fall Ball overnight stay with hubby

ProviderLocation: 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast) 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast)
ReviewText: excellent location to rittenhouse square area. lots of restaurants around. easy access to some of the sights. hotel is is comfortable with friendly staff and comfortable bed and room. breakfast is basic but tastes great and plenty of it. nice to be eating on proper china and cutlery rather than just paper plates as many hotels are moving to.

ProviderLocation: 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast) 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast)
ReviewText: Rittenhouse 1715 is a very nice hotel. A bit off the beaten path to the touristy locations, which does make it nice and quite. There are many nice resturants close by. I would definately stay here again.

ProviderLocation: 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast) 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast)
ReviewText: I stayed one night as I had to be at CHOP very early in the morning. I try to stay and cool and unique hotels when I travel, and this one was a good choice. Parking was excellent - directly across the street and not outrageously priced. The girl at the desk was friendly and helpful and offered to call me a car service for the next morning. There was a little complimentary wine and cheese gathering in the lobby for guests. The room was nicely appointed, clean and very quiet, the bed was comfortable. It was nice that someone turned down my bed and left a chocolate when I went out to eat. The bathroom was clean and spacious, however there was a skylight above the shower that slightly freaked me out, as I could see lights from other hotels/apartments from it! It did add light to a windowless bathroom though. They had complimentary robes and free wifi, which I always appreciate. Unfortunately, due to timing, I didn't get the opportunity to try the complimentary breakfast. I also liked that there are plenty of great restaurants nearby, literally around the corner. Walking at night seemed safe in this area. I would recommend this place.

ProviderLocation: 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast) 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast)
ReviewText: My room was comfortable, clean, well laid out and QUIET (although only a half a block from Rittenhouse Square). The 24 hour amenities, such as internet, gourmet coffee and filtered water were much appreciated, as was the complementary wine and cheese reception. The outstanding staff starting with the manager, Daniel Gioioso, could not have been more helpful or hospitable, from making the reservation, check in and check out, and providing suggestions for attractions, walk and restaurants. The continental breakfast was far more than I expected. It was varied, excellent and delicious.

ProviderLocation: 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia , PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast) 1715 Rittenhouse Square Street , Philadelphia, PA 19103 (Formerly Rittenhouse Square Bed and Breakfast)
ReviewText: This cute botique hotel just off Rittenhouse Square is all about the enviable location. The breakfast in the darling cafe downstairs is also very charming but very, very carb heavy. I'm sure other rooms had a better ambiance but I was stuck on the first floor just in the back off the lobby. Try to not stay in the two rooms off this little hallway. First, you feel like you are in a dank cave. The window is transom-like in that is way overhead. This is probably so whomever is in the back alley cannot see into the room. Good thing. Second, fact that lots of people traverse, hang out and smoke in said alley is the bad thing. The kitchen folks talking loud and smoking out there just inches from your bed at 5:30 am...really bad thing. My least favorite part of this room was that the temperature controls are in a locked box in the lobby. After my first night in the meat locker I asked where was the thermostat and they were very nice about raising the temp. The staff is very friendly. The off site parking they directed me to was great and well priced. If you can stay in a better room I would probably highly recommend this darling botique hotel. After this visit tho, I believe we'll stay elsewhere until our son finishes law school.
ReviewTitle: Great Location, Pricey but breakfast included

ProviderName: Courtyard Philadelphia South at The Navy Yard
ProviderLocation: 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19112-1227 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19112-1227
ReviewText: My husband and I arrive after a concert. I was not feeling very well and look exhausted, immediately the front desk a man named Teo was very nice and offered a late check out. He saw I was so tired as I told him I haven't slept in more then 24 hours and was my only night out with out my baby twins. He took it upon himself to offered and extended time on my check out. I was so happy for that extra time to sleep. He was very helpful gave me a room that was very quite and I had a great night sleep. The morning the everyone was very nice at the front desk, and also the lounge, food was good. We will be back this place is beautiful and clean.

ProviderName: Courtyard Philadelphia South at The Navy Yard
ProviderLocation: 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19112-1227 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19112-1227
ReviewText: We have stayed here many times and have never been disappointed. Cafe off of the lobby area has bar like feel and big screen TV. Food limited but very well prepared and great choices. Availability of cocktails is nice before a night out on the town. Rooms clean, comfortable and quiet. Easy access on and off of I-95 as well as a straight shot into the city.

ProviderName: Courtyard Philadelphia South at The Navy Yard
ProviderLocation: 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19112-1227 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19112-1227
ReviewText: The hotel was great. The restaurant had great food and reasonable prices. The staff was super helpful. It was an easy walk over to the Wells Fargo Center to see our event. Would definitely stay here again if I visit Philly again!

ProviderName: Courtyard Philadelphia South at The Navy Yard
ProviderLocation: 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19112-1227 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19112-1227
ReviewText: This hotel is in the newly built business park at the Navy Yard. It has free parking and it feels very tucked away- quiet and good for a peaceful nights sleep. It's away from downtown Phily but we travelled by taxi ($30) and back to the hotel by Uber ($12). The hotel itself is great- rooms large and fresh- bed comfortable. The staff on the front desk were superb- super friendly and happy. I would definitely stay here again.
ReviewTitle: Nice & new- amazingly friendly desk staff

ProviderName: Courtyard Philadelphia South at The Navy Yard
ProviderLocation: 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19112-1227 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19112-1227
ReviewText: I would recommend this place to anyone! Staff was very friendly helped in anyway they could. The rooms were very neat and clean. Even had a fresh smell to them. The bathrooms were big for a hotel. Definitely spend the extra money to get a nice place. Very safe location.

ProviderName: Courtyard Philadelphia South at The Navy Yard
ProviderLocation: 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19112-1227 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19112-1227
ReviewText: Very clean great business center and have stayed here twice. My only recomendation would be for cofee service in the rooms.They do have one cup makers but thats not me thing. No charge for parking and right in the middle of the old Philadelphia Dockyard

ProviderName: Courtyard Philadelphia South at The Navy Yard
ProviderLocation: 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19112-1227 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19112-1227
ReviewText: I've stayed at many Marriott's in Philadelphia, and this is my least favorite. Stay here only if you want to be close to the Wells Fargo Center. Very hard to get to within the Navy yard complex. There was an event going on when I was there (game at Wells Fargo Center) and the hotel was crowded and noisy. Also had few amenities.
ReviewTitle: Close to Wells Fargo Center only benefit

ProviderName: Courtyard Philadelphia South at The Navy Yard
ProviderLocation: 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19112-1227 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19112-1227
ReviewText: Only stayed at the hotel for 8 hours or so, but staff was great at check in. A little hard to get to if you aren't expecting to check in with security guard, but made me feel safe. Room was up to date and clean, will stay again soon. Lots of lights in the room with a sleek design. Thanks for a great stay!!!

ProviderName: Courtyard Philadelphia South at The Navy Yard
ProviderLocation: 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19112-1227 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19112-1227
ReviewText: Industrial chic in a retired Navy Yard corporate park that's quiet on weekends. Half of yard's closed and re-routed on weekends so consider it part of your mission to find hotel as a maze and you'll have a good laugh. Right off 95 and near NJ. Prob. best for car drivers or nearby sporting event attendees only. Retro lounge and Starbucks products in the lobby. Deserted streets and looming mothballed ships felt like a Brit post-nuclear movie. Parked right in front like I owned the place.

ProviderName: Courtyard Philadelphia South at The Navy Yard
ProviderLocation: 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia , PA 19112-1227 1001 Intrepid Ave , Philadelphia, PA 19112-1227
ReviewText: I gave this hotel another try in October 2014 after not being impressed with my first stay here in January 2014. I had a better stay this time as the state of cleanliness in my room was much improved. I enjoyed plenty of room on a king size bed and a peaceful night's sleep with no outside noise. There was also a sofabed provided in the room, but I had no use for it. The prices to stay here are a bit high, but that's what you get for Philadelphia. You'll pay 15.5% total tax each night of your stay. This hotel's location was the main draw for me. Once again, free parking was a plus. Photos uploaded to assist you with your lodging choice.
ReviewTitle: Free parking, Clean Rooms (3.7 out of 5)

ProviderLocation: 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3510 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3510
ReviewText: The room and staff were great. The downfall is how they rape you $39 for forced valet parking. There is no parking lot or garage, you either pay the exorbitant fee or park on the streets of Philadelphia.

ProviderLocation: 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3510 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3510
ReviewText: My wife and I were extremely dissatisfied with your breakfast. The food did not look anything like what was represented in the photos displayed in the elevators. I've had better experiences at other major chain hotels offering free breakfast. Yogurt was offered bulk, in a large bowl instead of offering singe serve cups. Even if the philosophy was to be environmentally sensitive, why wasn't fresh cut fruit or granola offered to augment the flavor of the yogurt? There was no bacon, the eggs were one large glob in the chafing dish, and the staff was not prompt in refilling food items.

ProviderLocation: 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3510 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3510
ReviewText: Perfect location for anyone needing quick access to University of Pa Hospital buildings. Very efficient shuttle service. Parking at the hotel is expensive, so if you plan on medical appointments at U of P, part at the hospital overnight and call the shuttle to take you to the hotel. Fast service and overnight cost for parking for patients and seniors is around 9 dollars. Next day return to the hospital via shuttle for appointments and your car.

ProviderLocation: 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3510 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3510
ReviewText: The hotel was close to Penn Medicine, shops and restaurants. The hotel staff were pleasant and willing to assist. The valet was very helpful upon arrival and departure. The suite was valued added while in Philly

ProviderLocation: 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3510 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3510
ReviewText: My husband and I visited this hotel to use some of our Hilton Honors points. It was a very comfortable stay, and much needed break from a long work week. The suite was a nice size and had everything that's needed for an extended stay, except for an oven (only a 2 burner stove). The view from the room was amazing. The only problem that we had was that the ice maker, in the freezer, didn't work all that well, and the ice had a very funny taste. Needless to say, we didn't feel comfortable putting the little ice that was made in our drinks. Other than that, the hotel was very nicely decorated, the front desk staff were very friendly, and we easily found parking across the street to avoid the $20 valet parking fee. We would definitely visit again!

ProviderLocation: 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3510 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3510
ReviewText: If you need to get to U of Penn Hosp, this is a good choice as there is a shuttle and you don't need to take a cab. The food at the "evening social" isn't great but there is wine and you don't have to go out. Breakfast is somewhat better, and again, you don't have to go out. Staff is very accommodating. Pool is small but nice and warm.
ReviewTitle: convenient hotel to Uof Penn Medical

ProviderLocation: 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3510 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3510
ReviewText: The hotel I go to is literally one block away from TAKII, a small "convention" I attend twice a year. The place is really nice but not overtly expensive (depending upon what calendar day you are staying). The staff are nice and around for assistance. The complimentary breakfast used to be better but is still great. If you are cold easy, pack an extra blanket or order one over because the room setup leaves the air colder.

ProviderLocation: 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3510 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3510
ReviewText: I stayed for 5 nights in a one bedroom suite with King Bed. I felt very comfortable throughout my stay. All of the staff members, from receptionist, valet, breakfast room staff, and housekeeping, are all very kind and helpful. The room was clean, the bed comfortable. There's hot breakfast buffet every morning, menu changed slightly each day. There are scrambled eggs, sausage patties, hashbrowns, yogurt station, pastries, cereals, and fruit. Some days we get to make our own waffles. Coffee also available 24/7 in the breakfast room. Definitely recommend. I would definitely consider booking at Homewood again, even in different city. Thank you, staff at Homewood Suites University City for making my stay a memorable and comfortable one.

ProviderLocation: 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3510 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3510
ReviewText: Great stay will be back soon! My room was very nice, the bed was heaven,great location to everything very quiet rooms friendly staff snacks were pretty high and parking but overall it was great well kept hoteliers

ProviderLocation: 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19104-3510 4109 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19104-3510
ReviewText: The experience was "OK" Nothing special and price was considerable for an average hotel and facilities I would recommend it to someone who couldn't find anything else for their stay Certainly expensive for extende stas

ProviderLocation: 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust) 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust)
ReviewText: We stayed here some years ago and loved it, so when planning a weekend in Philly I did not look elsewhere. The Independent is charming and unique. The hotel begins on the second floor. It is very well located, and parking at EZ park is a block away. Staff is both friendly and efficient. A continental breakfast is delivered to the room or packed to go if desired, and it is a lovely breakfast, with fruit, juice, yogurt and choice of croissant and jam, cheese danish, or bagel and cream cheese. This is my favorite hotel in Philly, and I have stayed in several others for conferences. We will stay here again when we need a hotel in the city. Also a nice lobby with coffee and tea 24 hours, reception 24 hours. Nice art everywhere. Access provided to Fitness center nearby.Good restaurants abound.

ProviderLocation: 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust) 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust)
ReviewText: We were here last year, enjoyed stay so much we are back. We had a super cyber Monday deal and upgraded our stay to a king deluxe suite. Second floor convenient to lobby area and elevator. However, loud rowdy lovers quarrel 12:30 AM outside of Bud & Marilyn's right under our window was a little difficult, so I would not recommend staying on 13 th side. Go for higher floors. Hotel Location is phenomenal, walking distance to Independence area, Kimmel, all major center city attractions. Suite was great with couch, electric fireplace, desk, firm mattress, nice d√©cor. Bathroom with shower stall, nicely equipped & large. Continental breakfast, nice and delivered timely both mornings, fruit,juice ,bagel, pastry option. Staff friendly and answered any questions. Keurig- wth coffee& Tea K cups, frig, microwave in our room Many clubs, restaurants in area. Ate at Bud & Marilyn's this visit- on first floor- also Little Nonnas recommended. Patco line from NJ directly underground outside, walking distance from Septa Rail- Jefferson ( Old Market St) station. Will be back. Highly recommended
ReviewTitle: ANOTHER GREAT STAY/ OUTSTANDING MIDTOWN LOCATION

ProviderLocation: 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust) 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust)
ReviewText: We had a terrific experience at this quaint arts inspired boutique hotel. The staff was absolutely amazing!!! Each and EVERY person we dealt with was more than pleasant and accommodating - and genuine!!!! The room was very nice and we loved the fact that the draperies completely darkened the room which allowed for a peaceful nights sleep and some much needed extra hours of sleep in the morning. Close to many restaurants, bars and shops within easy walking distance. Only downside at all was that the parking accommodations were confusing - in the end we had to receive voucher from hotel before we left car at lot across the street and then they honored the 24 hour rate of $23 (prior to working out hotel deal they wanted to charge $35 even though we told them we were staying at hotel). Overall we would stay here again and again. Definitely recommend!

ProviderLocation: 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust) 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust)
ReviewText: The Independent is a great little boutique hotel right in the middle of center city Philadelphia. The staff was very friendly. Our room was clean. It's an easy location to move around the city. You're a couple of blocks from Rittenhouse Sq. Getting to old town is an easy walk. Great Price, Clean Room. Why pay for the big chains when you get the same if not better in this boutique hotel

ProviderLocation: 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust) 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust)
ReviewText: This place is nice and modern. They bring breakfast right to your door which is convenient. The first day we never got ours, though that may have been my mistake with putting the wrong room down. It's not very quiet- I could hear the rooms next to us and they weren't exactly being loud. It might be a little claustrophobic for some people. The bathroom was nice and the location is great- right near the center of the city. You get a lot of TV channels and it appears very clean.
ReviewTitle: Nice room, close to center city

ProviderLocation: 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust) 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust)
ReviewText: We loved staying here because of the location. The room was huge even though we hadn't upgraded. There'd been complaints by other reviewers about the noise. We were there on a Wednesday night and it was very quiet. The breakfast was delivered to the door on a tray which was nice but since there wasn't a place to sit other than the bed (ok, one desk chair) I didn't like dropping crumbs and worrying about the duvet cover. The coffee was ok but the little packets of sugar, powdered creamer, etc. felt kind of tacky. I should have checked to see if there was actual half and half in the lobby where more coffee was available. So we went out for coffee after we checked out. David, the desk attendant was very nice and helpful. We'd definitely go back.

ProviderLocation: 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust) 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust)
ReviewText: Overall I had a nice stay. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and the location is pretty central to a lot of great stuff. The only problem I had (which is beyond their control) is the noise level from the street below. Being in such an active location, there was a constant barrage of yelling at night, and a ton of construction noise starting early in the morning. As a result, I was not able to get the restful night's sleep I badly needed. Again, this is a sacrifice you make for being in the heart of a bustling and active part of the city. I would stay here again, but would bring ear plugs.

ProviderLocation: 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust) 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust)
ReviewText: Stayed while volunteering for the election this year. Nice place - very large rooms with high ceilings. Couldn;'t comment on the breakfast as I went out - there's lots of good places for a substantial breakfast nearby. I'd recommend the Green Eggs cafe. Good location. I got in late Monday night and the staff was very helpful and accomodating in getting me settled. Parking convenient and not too expensive. I got a discount with the room.
ReviewTitle: Nice hotel with lots of character

ProviderLocation: 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust) 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust)
ReviewText: Very nice and central boutique hotel. My room was large, very clean with plenty of storage and a good sized comfortable bed. There was no safe in the room (advertised that there would be one) and I had a small leak in the bathroom but this was dealt with promptly. Free WiFi was also available and this worked perfectly for me. I didn't have any breakfast as the options on the menu were very limited so I chose to eat in one of the nearby cafes (Green Egg Cafe opposite is perfect) - the hotel is centrally located so loads of places available nearby for food / drinks. I read many comments about this location and how it was noisy in the evening but I didn't personally experience any problems and slept well. The only real issue I felt was staffing. There was only ever one person on the front desk and this meant I had to wait a long time both to check-in and check-out. On arriving I had over a 15 minute wait because there was one person ahead of me and after a long day travelling this wasn't appeciated or I felt acceptable for a hotel of this quality. Even with this mind, I would certainly consider staying here again and would happily recommend to anyone visiting the city for a short break. Thanks.

ProviderLocation: 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia , PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust) 1234 Locust St , Philadelphia, PA 19107-5612 (Formerly The Inn on Locust)
ReviewText: When I booked this hotel online I was hoping that it was as beautiful as the pictures and it was. Lovely hardwood floors, a lot of space and more dresser drawers than I have in my home! Friendly staff, great location, easy parking and a nice light breakfast delivered to the room. I will stay here again!
ReviewTitle: As wonderful as I had hoped!

ProviderLocation: 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia , PA 19103-6179 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia, PA 19103-6179
ReviewText: Great experience,this was my 2nd annual birthday celebration with my girlfriend!Place is trendy,clean great location-a few blocks top notch retail stores and Rittenhouse park.Abundance of casual and upscale restaurants blocks away.I think you will be quite satisfied...Place is 2 for 2 for quality,clean and service outstanding...enjoy!!

ProviderLocation: 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia , PA 19103-6179 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia, PA 19103-6179
ReviewText: First time at The Warwick Hotel and it was very nice. Lobby is modern, staff was very friendly and helpful. Check in/out was easy. The room was big (12th floor) and clean. The shower was not impressive as it was just a tub/shower combo. Parking in Philadelphia is getting worse every year and even more so if you prefer self-parking. We ended up self-parking a few blocks away at the Observatory. The Prime Rib is located within this hotel, which was nice. There is also a small breakfast place in the lobby, but we didn't eat there. Overall, it was a nice hotel and great location.

ProviderLocation: 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia , PA 19103-6179 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia, PA 19103-6179
ReviewText: My wife and I stayed at the The Warwick Hotel Rittenhouse Square for one night, on Sunday February 19, for $92.52 after choosing a Hotwire Hot Rate hotel, and using a $15.00 off coupon. The pros of this hotel include: Good location, close to Rittenhouse square, where my wife and I needed to be for an engagement. Nice, elegant foyer and large spacious rooms, with free internet. (The rooms also come with two free bottles of water). Accommodating and pleasant staff, they held our bags after checkout for a few hours for free which was nice. The cons of this hotel are: Hotwire stated that they had a ‚Äúfree shuttle‚Äù on their hot rate description. They actually do not have a free shuttle to the airport, which was a bummer. This might be a hotwire issue though, and not necessarily a Warwick hotel issue. Had to get an Uber to the airport instead which was an extra $15.00. Parking is expensive- $38.00 per night for self-parking, valet is $45.00 per night. (if you drive to the hotel). We were in room 624-on the 6th floor, right next to the elevators. I am a light sleeper and could hear everyone get on and off the elevator throughout the night. I wish there was better sound insulation, lots of drunk loud guests coming off the elevator all night, which made it difficult to sleep. A tip, ask for a room AWAY from the elevator. I would stay in this hotel again if I got a room under $100.00 a night, and I was able to choose a room away from the elevators.
ReviewTitle: Nice Hotel Rooms, But ask for a room away from Elevators

ProviderLocation: 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia , PA 19103-6179 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia, PA 19103-6179
ReviewText: Just got back from spending the holiday weekend at this hotel for 2 nights/3 days. The experience in this hotel was awful from the minute we arrived to us checking out. Upon checking in they could not find our reservation and made us wait a very long time with no explanation of what was happening. The staff was not helpful and made it seem like it was our fault that our reservation was not coming up in their system. We even had our confirmation and information all printed and gave it to the front desk and they were expecting us to have all the answers. After a very long time and no compensation for this we finally went to our room. There were cracks on the ceiling and stains in the tub. The hot water lasted for a very short time in the shower. We then went out the next day and when we came back to our room to shower before our dinner reservations, our key did not work. The maid saw us down the hall and said that the room was supposed to be checked out and we had to go collect our bags from a different location. The only problem with this was that we still had another night for our reservation. We then went back down to the lobby and waited once again for a problem to be solved, missing our reservations to the restaurant down the street in the process. The gentleman that helped us was kind enough to give us access to a small area on the 11th floor that provided drinks and light food. We decided to check this area out since we missed our reservations, only to be disappointed an almost empty fridge and bar and a minimal selections of ravaged snacks. We went about the rest of our trip and the next day we checked out. Upon checkout we noticed a charge for an upgrade to our room for $170. We turned back to the desk and were given no explanation of what that charge was for but it was removed. My only assumption could be that we were charged that much for the area that provided drinks and snacks. We then gave our ticket to the valet parking and waited 30 minutes to pick up our car, when there was no one else in front of us. This was my first time in Philadelphia and I would tell anyone that is in the area or any area that offers a Warwick Hotel to stay anywhere else and do yourself a favor and find another hotel.
ReviewTitle: Awful experience from check in to checkout.

ProviderLocation: 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia , PA 19103-6179 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia, PA 19103-6179
ReviewText: We stay here often as we go into the city once a month for dining and getting away. It's a great location and the front desk staff is wonderful as well as the valet service. However, I would not recommend you spend the $20 per person for the breakfast buffet. It was our first time and it was deplorable for the price. We got there at 10am on a Sunday morning. We couldn't get a table because it was busy but the tables that were empty had not been cleaned off. There was no bottled water. The scrambled egg skillet was empty. The bread table had one English muffin on it. All the glasses were dirty and the shelf for the clean ones was empty as well as no clean coffee cups or a napkin in sight. We could hear the staff behind the door labeled Staff Only. They were having fabulous time back there laughing and talking. After 20 minutes one of them emerged in slow motion to clear tables. This hotel very nice and I have stayed there many times without disappointment. This was a first. I will return but NEVER to the buffet. Not sure where the manager was but they clearly should have been on site. Don't waste your money on the buffet!!!!!! There are many nice places nearby that have actual food choices and are well stocked.

ProviderLocation: 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia , PA 19103-6179 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia, PA 19103-6179
ReviewText: Even though I'm an SPG member, I decided to cancel my reservation at the Westin Hotel and stay at the Warwick Hotel instead since I liked this location much better - it's literally a few blocks from Rittenhouse Square and the gorgeous park there. Front desk staff (Robert S and Shakira) were both friendly and welcoming. I requested a quiet room and the check-in process went pretty smoothly. The lobby is also beautiful and great if you want to meet with friends/family - comfortable chairs, etc. Beautiful light fixtures. My room was a great size and the bed was comfortable. I had no issues with the bathroom either as some other guests mentioned. Unfortunately, I didn't realize that I had an adjoining room and I was able to hear the loud TV from the guests next to me most of the evening/early morning. The front desk tried to accommodate me by offering to change my room but it was so late I didn't want to 'relocate'. I have to give props to Lauren at the front desk who in a gesture of good will when I was checking out, contacted the Sales Department so that I could return to the hotel for another visit in the future for a complimentary stay. Shout out to Nader and Bridget from Sales who took care of the paperwork for my next stay. I'm keeping my fingers crossed - I really love this hotel, and hope to make it my 'go-to' hotel whenever I'm in Philly, which is often. As a light sleeper, I'll be sure the next time around, to request that I don't get an adjoining room (or one next to the elevator)!

ProviderLocation: 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia , PA 19103-6179 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia, PA 19103-6179
ReviewText: I had a Groupon for 50% off the already good price. The room was very large and spacious and I had a very comfortable, king size bed. I didn't have a view, but will ask for one next time. For me the best part was the location and the wonderful Bluestone Cafe next door -- a great place for coffee and breakfast. The room had a coffee maker with Lavazza coffee and a nice, easy to operate flat screen TV. It was very conducive for sleeping. It was quiet and there were blinds to make the room nice and dark for sleeping. 2 small water bottle are replenished every day. The reason i didn't give it 5 stars is that there was nothing special (besides the really awesome breakfast next door) to distinguish the hotel. I didn't feel they went the extra mile - there was hot tea in the lobby but not coffee or water or cookies. The desk crew was fine but not exceptional. However i never used the concierge or called room service. and i will say both times i called with a slight issue -i.e. i couldn't figure out how to drain the bathroom sink and coffee filter holder on coffee pot was missing - i had immediate response and someone came up to the room quickly and resolved the issue.
ReviewTitle: Great location and great hotel for the price!

ProviderLocation: 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia , PA 19103-6179 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia, PA 19103-6179
ReviewText: Had a wonderful stay. Place is very clean and people at the frontdesk were very courteous and professional. Their doorman, valet are also professional and courteous people. Robert at the frontdesk was the best frontdesk professional I have experienced in my days of travel.
ReviewTitle: Very clean and staff very efficient

ProviderLocation: 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia , PA 19103-6179 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia, PA 19103-6179
ReviewText: My hotel stay was very nice. The employees are very nice and helpful. Deborah was great. She always kept my room very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area. It has a great location and happy staff.

ProviderLocation: 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia , PA 19103-6179 220 South 17th St , Philadelphia, PA 19103-6179
ReviewText: I got in later in the evening, approximately 11 p.m. Check-in was smooth and effortless. My room got upgraded because the one I originally booked was sold out. My room was clean and quiet. Nice view of the city. Loved the Philadelphia headboard. Only one problem, the shower gel in the bathroom was 1/2 empty (used). Not enough of a problem to keep me from returning, but more attention needs to be paid to the small details.

ProviderLocation: 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: I honestly don't normally stay in Holiday Inn but this property called out to me because of the location. I was surprised at how big the guest room was and that it was very clean. The staff couldn't do enough for me. They managed a car that had to be parked. I also needed a cab to the airport and they told me to sit in the lobby and they would have a driver come in and get me. Wow, nice service. The hotel was jamming, you could tell and the only part where it showed was in getting the room serviced. After a long day of shopping we came back to find the room just getting done. The attendant was great and hurried up and finished. The location was amazing, with all kinds of restaurants and bars and excellent shopping right out the front door. I would definitely go back!!
ReviewTitle: Great location in the center of it all

ProviderLocation: 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: If you are visiting doctors or hospitals in the area---and there are LOTS nearby---you will be happy you stayed here. You can walk to your medical provider and also to many eateries in the vicinity. The front desk and housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful. One complaint: the emergency alarm sounded (and sounded continuously) for about 30 minutes after 12:30 at night. There was no follow up announcement that all was well, which I would've appreciated. I was therefore unable to go back to sleep for a LONG time.

ProviderLocation: 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: Very friendly and professional staff. Room was comfortable, and requests were met. As far as bed, I prefer a thinner pillow, and the sheets appear to be a very low thread count, so not as soft as I would like. Very convenient to theaters.

ProviderLocation: 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: We stayed here for three days. At he outset I will say the reception looks tired and belies the fact that the hotel is in a great location. The room was very clean and tidy and our bedding was changed every day. The only down side was that the are a bit stingy with the coffee pods but will give you a couple more if you ask. The rooms are a good size and try to get one as high possible for the views ( we were on the top floor 20). However the star is f the show are their breakfasts. A sumptuous spread with the hot options different each day. It really is a banquet of food with all options catered for. The staff are delightful and can't do enough for you. If you want a good hotel right in the centre of Philidelphia this is the place.
ReviewTitle: Don't be put off by reception area

ProviderLocation: 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: We chose this hotel for its great central location to many of the tourist sites, which meant more time to play rather than driving, and because it offers the Cell Block 7 pacakge. We came to Philly specifically to check out Eastern State Pen & Terror Behind the Walls. The hotel itself was clean and the staff were always polite and friendly and our room (1201) was clean and inviting. The bed was comfortable but just not for us. There was minimal ambient noise which was a concern since our room was right next to the elevator. The bathroom was clean, but for taller people the shower head will be too short and it will be awkward trying to get the toilet paper since it's so close to the toilet. The hot complimentary brealfast was edible with a good variety of options. I was quite apprehensive aboit the parking after reading the other reviews. When we arrived on Sunday about 5pm we were able to park the car ourselves and take the keys with us. Since we already knew we would be taking taxis everywhere, we weren't concerned about moving it, which would jave prompted them to have us leave our key. It was $27/day through the hotel, and you are able to go in and out as you please. However, when we did go to leave today, they had to move 6 cars so we could get out....they definitely pack them in! After watching them move all the cars, I'm not to sure I'd want them driving mine, amd they do lwave the key in the ignition and the doors unlocked.

ProviderLocation: 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: I have to be honest. Holiday Inn Express is not usually my first choice for lodging, but this hotel changed any previous perception I'd had of the brand. Of course the location in Midtown was ideal for a quick theatre trip and a history lesson, but what got me most was the service and the accommodations themselves. My check in was ideal. The staff at the front desk was amazing and thorough, especially when learning it was my first time in Philadelphia. It really set the tone for my two days in the hotel. My room on one of the top floors was ideal and much larger than I'd expected and had a great view of the city below. There was nothing I could have asked to be better at this hotel. I'll definitely be back.
ReviewTitle: Great Location and a Great Hotel

ProviderLocation: 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: Clean, large room. ALL the staff were fabulous, especially Inez. Perfect location for sightseeing, shopping, restaurants. Good complimentary breakfast that stays open until noon on weekends; 10:30 on weekdays. I will stay again.

ProviderLocation: 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: The traffic is non stop and so is the noise from it. Although I had booked a river view room there was still a lot of traffic but by the second day I'd got used to it probably as I was so tired from the sightseeing! The hotel staff are friendly and efficient. Also there are hot drinks available downstairs all day. The rooms was very clean and comfortable.
ReviewTitle: A great hotel if you don't mind. ...

ProviderLocation: 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: the hotel is in walking distance to the independence hall and the liberty bell. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The room was quite spacious and the bed was comfortable. Although the lobby could do with a lick of paint. I would stay here again if I went to Philly again.

ProviderLocation: 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia , PA 19107 1305 Walnut St , Philadelphia, PA 19107
ReviewText: Arrived late and staff was very accomadating. Front desk went out of their way to help and accomadags needs. The room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was huge and loved the handheld shower head. Room was attended to daily and linens and toweis fresh. Hall was cool and easy to reach vending. Hard to get a taxi outside hotel. Staff was able to summon one upon request. Various resturaunt around hotel for dinner options.

ProviderLocation: 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia , PA 19102 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia, PA 19102
ReviewText: My significant other and I decided to book a hotel in Philadelphia, despite being from the area, to eliminate the need to drive during a celebratory weekend. We found an excellent deal on Le Meridien through a popular booking website and decided to take advantage of it. The facility itself is lovely, despite some construction currently underway. It's centrally located, with quick access to a subway stop. Additionally, the valet service was great about hailing taxis during Uber surge times. The staff was also very friendly and check-in was simple and headache-free. Most amenities, perhaps predictably in a hotel at this price point in a major city, were not complimentary and were overpriced - even WiFi. It felt a bit like we were being squeezed, but this wasn't necessarily unexpected for the weekend. Housekeeping was an issue, which really was what made the whole experience pretty underwhelming. We spent all of our first full day out of our room, returning nearly at dinner, and our room hadn't been cleaned. At that point, we figured, Forget it, we'll call down for anything we need, and we hung up the Do Not Disturb sign since we would be in and out much more frequently for the rest of the evening. The next morning, housekeeping came by early, at about 8am, while we were still sleeping. I can't help wondering if we were placed at the bottom of the priority list because we were paying less than other patrons. Basically, we got the experience you would expect from an $83/night hotel/motel, not the type of hotel Le Meridien advertises itself to be. Overall, it was okay - but we definitely wouldn't come back paying sticker price.

ProviderLocation: 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia , PA 19102 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia, PA 19102
ReviewText: we are spg platinum and not every property recognizes it. We were able to get early check in and late check out. Only thing missing was the room upgrade but I'll take it! We were in town for a convention and hotel was nicely located a 3 min walk from Convention Center. Service was great. Room was OK, a little small. Beds were a little hard. They are redoing the lobby so that's kinda annoying. Overall hotel was good and I would come back.

ProviderLocation: 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia , PA 19102 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia, PA 19102
ReviewText: We reserved the Presidents' Day weekend to enjoy Philadelphia. We arrived at one and no rooms were ready. The reservation agent confirmed my Starwood membership and checked our bags. She told us the hotel was overbooked but we wouldn't have a problem as an SPG member. When we returned 4 hours later we were given a beautiful king room with separate sitting area. The room is lovely.. Quiet and comfortable. Looking forward to the next couple days in Philly.

ProviderLocation: 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia , PA 19102 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia, PA 19102
ReviewText: Have stayed here twice and now and each time has been wonderful. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The first time we were there we asked for an empty mini fridge (rather than the already filled ones) and it was promptly delivered. The second time I was having some issues with my back and they were very accommodating. I spoke with Rhea who was so helpful and put me at ease. It's a BEAUTIFUL hotel and the beds are super comfortable. When you stay, ask for a room facing city hall and on a high floor. It's a wonderful sight to wake up to in the morning and a beautiful view at night. Which brings me to the location... it's PERFECT! You are literally close to everything! We found so many fun things to do all in walking distance. If you're not into walking, the longest an Uber ride would have been said like 8 minutes.. and that's in the city. I can't say enough nice things about Le Meridian. Hopefully we'll be back soon!

ProviderLocation: 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia , PA 19102 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia, PA 19102
ReviewText: This hotel provided professional service from valet, check-in and room service. If seeing a show or just visiting I totally recommend a stay at the Le Meridien. Valet is a bit expensive however it's the city.

ProviderLocation: 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia , PA 19102 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia, PA 19102
ReviewText: Stayed here in January for one night. Great location, very friendly staff overall. Check in was fast and efficient. Ordered room service and the food was delicious. I loved the design of the hotel, very modern and beautiful. The only thing I was not happy about is that the walls were too thin and you could hear everything from the other rooms, but other than that it was a great stay.

ProviderLocation: 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia , PA 19102 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia, PA 19102
ReviewText: The location is perfect, close to everything a tourist want to visit in philly. Also great location for morning run, Franklin parkway is just block away on the west. Room is reasonable for a $200 per night stay. Book early to get a room with a good view. ( I got inside view of the elevator bank but I'm not complaining.) i can work with the limited desk space, and that doesn't bother me much. Staff are very friendly to me. The fridge is full of merchandise as seen in pictures. I'm not complaining neither. But it's 2016 and wifi in room still cost $3 to start? Or did i miss something? Anyways, I enjoyed my stay with le meridien in philly. I would recommend friends stay in here as well. But hope the hotel have good free wifi in rooms by then.
ReviewTitle: Great location, great service, but $3.99 wifi?

ProviderLocation: 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia , PA 19102 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia, PA 19102
ReviewText: The hotel is great! Lovely staff, nice spacious rooms and super accesible to tourist spots in Philly:) The rooms are clean! And its everything that a neat freak like me would recommend:) I hope you enjoy Philly!
ReviewTitle: Beautiful, Clean Hotel in City Centre Philly

ProviderLocation: 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia , PA 19102 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia, PA 19102
ReviewText: This is my first time at this hotel and I can only say great things. As Starwood Gold I was upgraded to a Superior King with a view of Philadelphia City Hall. It was large, with a super comfortable bed and extra large bathroom. The lobby is lovely and welcoming. Great coffee in am and flavored water in pm. And the staff: very friendly and very professional. Well done. Great location as well. All and all a home run.

ProviderLocation: 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia , PA 19102 1421 Arch Street , Philadelphia, PA 19102
ReviewText: Staying at Le Meridien in Philadelphia gave me the combination of 1) a big beautiful room 2) perfect location and 3) excellent customer service. First, my room was big with a hall to the main area. It was designed with luxury in mind and you won't be disappointed. Second, the location was amazing. Just a few blocks from the Reading Terminal Market, it will be easy to walk to wherever you need to go in Center City. Third, excellent customer service. Bill and Katie at the front desk were amazing. They helped me get a great room and took care of me during my entire stay. I felt like a valued guest and as someone who has stayed in multiple Starwood hotels, I truly felt that they did everything they could to make my experience staying here a lovely one.
ReviewTitle: Big Beautiful Room in the Perfect Location!
